title: EACH PEACH PEAR PLUM
author: JANET AND ALLAN AHLBERG
text: Jack and Jill in the ditch

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: The kids in Room 207 were misbehaving again

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Paper planes whizzed through the air.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: They were the worst-behaved class in the whole school.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'Now settle down,' said Miss Nelson in a sweet voice.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: But the class would not settle down.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: They were even rude during story hour.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: And they always refused to do their lessons.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'Something will have to be done,' said Miss Nelson.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: The next morning Miss Nelson did not come to school.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'Wow!' yelled the kids. 'Now we can really act up!'

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: They began to make more spitballs and paper planes.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'Today let's be just terrible!' they said.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'Not so fast!' hissed an unpleasant voice.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: A woman in an ugly black dress stood before them.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'I am your new teacher, Miss Viola Swamp.'

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: And she rapped the desk with her ruler.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'Where is Miss Nelson?' asked the kids.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'Never mind that!' snapped Miss Swamp. 'Open those

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Miss Nelson's kids did as they were told.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: They could see that Miss Swamp was a real witch.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Right away she put them to work.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: And she loaded them down with homework.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'We'll have no story hour today,' said Miss Swamp.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'Keep your mouths shut,' said Miss Swamp.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'And if you misbehave you'll be sorry,' said

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: The kids in Room 207 had never worked so hard.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Days went by and there was no sign of Miss Nelson.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Maybe we should try to find her, they said.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Some of them went to the police.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Detective McSmogg was assigned to the case.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Other kids went to Miss Nelson's house.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: The shades were tightly drawn, and no one answered

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: In fact, the only person they did see was the wicked

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Miss Viola Swamp, coming up the street.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'If she sees is, she'll give us more homework.'

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: They got away just in time.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Maybe something terrible happened to Miss Nelson!

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'Maybe she was gobbled up by a shark!' said one of the kids.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'Maybe Miss Nelson went to Mars!' said another kid.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: But that didn't seem likely either.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'I know!' exclaimed one know-it-all. 'Maybe Miss Nelson's

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: car was carried off by a swarm of angry butterflies!'

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: But that was the least likely of all.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: The kids in Room 207 became very discouraged.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: It seemed that Miss Nelson was never coming back.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: And they would be stuck with Miss Viola Swamp forever.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: They heard footsteps in the hall.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'Hello, children,' someone said in a sweet voice.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'We certainly did!' cried all the kids.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'That's my little secret,' said Miss Nelson.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Miss Nelson noticed that during story hour no one

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'What brought about this lovely change?' she asked.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'That's our little secret,' said the kids.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: Back home Miss Nelson took off her coat and hung it

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: in the closet (right next to the ugly black dress).

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: When it was time for bed she sang a little song.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: 'I'll never tell,' she said to herself with a smile.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: P.S Detective McSmogg is working on a new case.

title: MISS NELSON IS MISSING
author: HARRY ALLARD
text: He is now looking for Miss Viola Swamp.

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: whose neck was long and slim.

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: But his knees were awfully crooked

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: and his legs were rather thin.

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: He was very good at standing still

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: But when he tried to run around,

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: turns up to skip and prance.

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: [[Jungle Dance]] And this year when the day arrived

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: because when it came to dancing

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: The chimps all did a cha-cha

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: and eight baboons then teamed up

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: Then he found a little clearing,

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: and he looked up at the sky.

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: you just need a different song.'

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: is those branches in the breeze.

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: So imagine that the lovely moon

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: if you really want it to.'

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: and his tail was swishing round.

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: He threw his legs out sideways,

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: Then he did a backward somersault

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: and leapt up in the air.

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: Then, one by one, each animal

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: who'd been there at the dance

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: We must be in a dream.

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: 'How did you learn to dance like that?

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: Then he raised his head and looked up

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: at the moon and stars above.

title: GIRAFFES CAN'T DANCE
author: GILES ANDREAE
text: ' when we find music that we love.'

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: [[Since childhood Mitsumasa Annos has been fascinated by Europe, by its varied

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: landscape, its art and architecture, its folklore and fairy tale, its people at their work

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: and play. In 1963 and again in 1975 Anno left his native Japan and journeyed through

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: many parts of Europe exploring, observing, painting and drawing as he went. He

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: found a world new to him, as it will be to many of his readers, but a world that is

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: deeply rooted in ancient traditions. This book is a record of that journey. Go with the

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: lone traveler on his way and you will encounter the paintings of the French

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: Impressionists, find musical notes from Beethoven's Ninth, tilt at the windmill with

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: Don Quixote and Sancho Panza, help to pull up The Enormous Turnip. Every

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: double-page spread in this book contains a while host of friends for those who can

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: find them, and each traveler with Anno can create his own version of the story.

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: Mitsumasa Anno writes of his journey: I followed the path wherever it went, up and

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: down hills, across rivers, through fields which spread out into great open spaces.

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: There were forests and rivers wherever I travelled; in the forests there were deer and

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: in the rivers there were trout. At the end of the road there were always houses

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: gathered together to make a town, and in every town there were gates, leading from

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: shops to squares to plazas, through graveyards and gardens to churches and

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: cathedrals. One town had a castle in its midst; one castle was a town by itself. They

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: gave me an image of the country, and each reflected the lie of that town, that

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: I wandered from town to town, from country to country and sometimes my

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: journey was hard, but it is at just such times that the reward comes. When a man

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: loses his way, he often finds himself  or some unlooked-for treasure. By the end of

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: my journey, I realized that I had set out not to collect information but to lose my

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: way  and to discover the world you will find in this book.

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: It is a world filled with variety, yet a simple place with a deep-rooted sense of

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: culture, an appreciation of nature that preserves it from destruction and pollution

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: Here are some things to look for in Anno's Journey:

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: Details from paintings by Courbet, Millet, Renoir, Seurat and other; all sorts

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: of children's games; an escaping prisoner; some characters from Sesame Street,

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: from The Pied Piper of Hamelin, The Emperor's New Clothes, Red Riding Hood,

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: Pinocchio, Don Quixote, and other beloved stories; a romantic tale, continued on

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: several pages, of love and retribution; a race; Beethoven sitting at a window;

title: ANNO'S JOURNEY
author: MISTSUMASA ANNO
text: an emptying bottle on a shop sign, to mention just a few.]]

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: When Jenny Linsky was having some of her first

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: adventures with the Cat Club I was working in the

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: children's department of a public library, and

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: living with a friend who had a bookshop in her house.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Of course we had Jenny's books in both the library

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: and the bookshop. We also had two cats, Sherlock

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Holmes and Dr. Watson. It is partly because of

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: those cats that I remember so vividly the first time

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: I read THE CAT CLUB aloud to children.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: I was on my way to the library one day when we

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: were expecting a class of second-graders from a

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: nearby school. Suddenly I heard a cat crying

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: behind me. It was Dr. Watson. I didn't have time to

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: take him back home and I didn't dare to leave him

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: for fear he might get lost, so I picked him up and

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: carried him into the library. Dr . Watson was used

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: to having books and people around him and he

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: settled himself comfortably on a table in front of

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: the children. They were delighted, of course, and

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: they loved THE CAT CLUB so much that I decided to

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: read it again the next day to the third-graders.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: That day I hadn't even had time to begin reading

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: before a girl raised her hand and said

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: reproachfully, "When the second grade came, you had a CAT."

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: It really didn't seem fair, so I hurried back to the

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: bookshop and got Sherlock Holmes. He too made

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: himself at home on the library table and greatly

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: amused the children by standing on his hind legs

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: and resting his front paws on the bookshelf above.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: He seemed to be looking with interest at a copy of

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: THE CAT CLUB on display there. Then he settled

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: down for the story. The third grade love? it as much

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: as the second grade had. A few days later several

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: of the children came in to tell me that they were

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: organizing a Cat Club in their neighborhood; they

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: had already found thirty-seven cats who could join

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: I They wanted Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson to

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: be in the club too, even if they couldn't come to the

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: meetings. I signed their names and thus enrolled

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: them as Honorary Members of the Hudson

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: As Miss Averill says, Jenny Linsky and the other

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Cat Club members were real cats and she knew

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: them all. You will feel that you know them all too.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Once you have made the acquaintance of shy little

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Jenny, wearing her red scarf, and big strong Pickles

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: in his fireman's helmet, you are not likely to forget

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: them. Perhaps you will have favorites. My

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: favorite, next to Jenny Linsky, is Pickles.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: There are other stories about the Cat Club that

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: are not included in this book. You can probably get

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: those in your library and I think you will want to,

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: if you love the stories as much as I do.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: THE CAT CLUB OR THE LIFE AND TIMES OF JENNY LINSKY

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: In Captain Tinker's garden, once upon a

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: time, there was a Cat Club. All the cats and

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: kittens in the neighborhood were members.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Jenny Linsky was a small black orphan

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: cat who lived with Captain Tinker. He had

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: found Jenny in the street where a dog was

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: chasing her. No one knew where she had

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: come from and the Captain took her home.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: He was very kind to Jenny. She had cream

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: and chicken every night for supper. Her

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: coal black fur grew soft and glossy. Her

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: yellow eyes began to have a happy look.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: On day the Captain said to her, "You

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: and I must always be best friends."

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: That made Jenny's heart beat fast.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: But the Captain added gently, "I think a

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: lite cat like you should go outdoors

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: sometimes and play. Lots of nice cats live in this

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Jenny had often heard the Cat Club

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: singing after dark. "They'd have fun," she thought.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: But se was too shy to say "hello" to them.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Captain Tinker, who was an old sailor,

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: liked to make things and many years ago had

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: learned to knit. He knitted a woolen scarf

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: for Jenny - a bright red woolen scarf to go

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: with her black fur and yellow eyes.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: How Jenny loved that scarf! How brave

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: she felt when she was wearing it! And one

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: fine night she put it on and went into the

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: It was a lovely garden full of flowers and

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: trees and bushes. On three sides were rows

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: of pink brick houses . On the other side was

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: a tall board fence that kept the dogs away.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Jenny and the Captain lived in the brick

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: house that was covered with ivy.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Jenny crept softly through the grass and

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: found a hiding place beneath a rosebush.

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: There she waited for the Cat Club. She

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Suddenly a slim white cat sped through

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: the grass, dashed up the maple tree and

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: began to sing. This was Concertina, the

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Come all ye cats and kittens

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: With your whiskers and your mittens

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: Mr. President was a well-fed cat who

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: always wore a collar with his name and

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB
author: ESTHER AVERILL
text: number on a tag. He walked slowly out of his

title: JENNY AND THE CAT CLUB

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Thomas was a tank engine who lived at a Big Station.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: He had six small wheels, a short stumpy funnel, a short

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: stumpy boiler, and a short stumpy dome.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: He was a fussy little engine, always pulling coaches about.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: He pulled them to the station ready for the big engines to take

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: out on long journeys; and when trains came in and the people

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: had got out, he would pull the empty coaches away so that the

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: big engines could go and rest.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: He was a cheeky little engine, too. He thought no engine

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: worked as hard as he did. So he used to

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: play tricks on them. He liked best of all to

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: come quietly beside a big engine dozing

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: on a siding and make him jump.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Peep, peep, peep, pip, peep! Wake up, lazybones!" he would

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: whistle. "Why don't you work hard like me?"

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Then he would laugh rudely and run away to find some

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: One day, Gordon was resting on a siding. He was very tired.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: The big Express he always pulled had been late, and he had

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: had to run as fast as he could to make up for lost time.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: He was just going to sleep when Thomas came up in his

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Wake up, lazybones," he whistled. "Do some hard work

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: for a change -- you can't catch me!" and he ran off laughing.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Instead of going to sleep again, gordon thought how he

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES

text: It was nearly time for the

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: At last, Thomas started. "Oh, dear! Oh, dear!" he yawned.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Come on," said the coaches. "Hurry up." Thomas gave

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: them a rude bump and started for the station.

author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Where have you been? Where have you been?" asked the

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Thomas fussed into the station, where Gordon was waiting.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Poop, poop, poop. Hurry up, you," said Gordon crossly.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Peep, pip, peep. Hurry yourself," said cheeky Thomas.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Yes," said Gordon, "I will." And almost before the coaches

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: had stopped moving, Gordon came out of his siding and was

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Poop, poop," he whistled. "Get in quickly, please." So the

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: people got in quickly, the signal went down, the clock struck

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: the hour, the Guard waved his green flag,

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: and Gordon was ready to start.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: big trains to help them start. But he was always uncoupled first

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: so that, when the train was running nicely, he could stop and

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: This time, he was late, and Gordon started so quickly that

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

author: REVEREND W AWDRY

author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Come on! Come on!" puffed Gordon to the coaches.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Pull harder! Pull harder!" puffed Thomas to Gordon.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: The heavy train slowly began to move out of the station.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: The train went faster and faster -- too fast for Thomas. He

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: wanted to stop, but he couldn't.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Hurry, hurry, hurry," laughed Gordon in front.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "You can't get away. You can't get away," laughed the

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Poor Thomas was going faster than he had ever gone

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: before. He was out of breath and his wheels hurt him, but

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "I shall never be the same again," he thought sadly. "My

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: wheels will be quite worn out."

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: At last, they stopped at a station. Everyone laughed to see

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: They uncoupled him, put him on a turntable, and then he

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: ran on a siding out of the way.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Well, little Thomas," chuckled Gordon as he passed.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Now you know what hard work means, don't you?"

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Poor Thomas couldn't answer. He had no breath. He just

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: puffed slowly away to rest and had a long, long drink.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: He went home very slowly and was careful afterwards never

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: to be cheeky to Gordon again.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Thomas often grumbled because he was not allowed to

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: The other engines laughed. "You're too impatient," they

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: said. "You'd be sure to leave something behind!"

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Rubbish," said Thomas crossly. "You just wait. I'll show

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: One night, he and Henry were alone. Henry was ill. The

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: men worked hard, but he didn't get better.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Now Henry usually pulled the first train in the morning,

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: and Thomas had to get his coaches ready.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "If Henry is ill," he thought, "perhaps I shall pull his train."

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Thomas ran to find the coaches.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES

author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Sir Topham Hatt came out of his office to see what was the

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: matter, and the Guard and the Station Master told him about

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

author: REVEREND W AWDRY

author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES

text: "You'll have to do it, then, Thomas. Be quick now!"

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: So Thomas ran round to the front and backed up to the

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Don't be impatient," said his Driver. "Wait till everything

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: But Thomas was too excited to listen to a word he said.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: What happened then, no one knows. Perhaps they forgot

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: to couple Thomas to the train, perhaps Thomas was too

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: impatient to wait till they were ready, or perhaps his Driver

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Anyhow, Thomas started. People shouted and waved at

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES

text: to pull trains, but I think it's easy."

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: As he passed the first signal box, he

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: saw the men leaning out, waving and

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "They're pleased to see me," he thought. "They've never

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: seen me pulling a train before. It's nice of them to wave." And

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: he whistled, "Peep, peep, thank you," and hurried on.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: But he came to a signal -- "Danger."

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Bother!" he thought. "I must stop, and I was going so

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: nicely, too. What a nuisance signals are!" And he blew an

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: One of the Signalmen ran up. "Hullo, Thomas!" he said.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "I'm pulling a train," said Thomas proudly. "Can't you see?"

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Thomas looked back. "Why, bless me," he said, "if we

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Yes," said the Signalmen, "you'd better go back quickly

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Poor Thomas was so sad he nearly cried.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Cheer up!" said his Driver. "Let's go back quickly and

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: At the station, all the passengers were talking at once. They

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: were telling Sir Topham Hatt, the Station Master, and the

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Guard what a bad railway it was.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: But when Thomas came back and they saw how sad he was,

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: they couldn't be cross. So they coupled him to the train, and

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: this time he really pulled it.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: But for a long time afterwards the other engines laughed at

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Look, there's Thomas, who wanted to pull a train but

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Thomas used to grumble in the Shed at night. "I'm tired

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: of pushing coaches. I want to see the world."

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: The others didn't take much notice, for Thomas was a little

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: But one night, Edward came to the Shed. He was a kind

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: little engine and felt sorry for Thomas.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "I've got some freight cars to take home tomorrow," he told

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: him. "If you take them instead, I'll push coaches in the Yard."

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Thank you," said Thomas, "that will be nice."

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: So they asked their Drivers the next morning, and when

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: they said "Yes," Thomas ran happily to find the freight cars.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Now, freight cars are silly and noisy. They talk a lot and

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: don't attend to what they are doing. They don't listen to

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: their engine, and when he stops, they bump into each other,

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: screaming, "Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Whatever is happening?"

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: And, I'm sorry to say, they play tricks on an engine who is

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Edward knew all about freight cars. He warned Thomas to

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: be careful, but Thomas was too excited to listen.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: The Switchman fastened the coupling, and when the signal

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: The Guard blew his whistle. "Peep! Peep!" answered Thomas,

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: But the freight cars weren't ready.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh!" they screamed as their couplings

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: tightened. "Wait, Thomas, wait." But Thomas wouldn't wait.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Come-on. Come-on," he puffed, and the freight cars

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: grumbled slowly out of the siding onto the Main Line.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Thomas was happy. "Come along. Come along," he puffed.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: grumbled the freight cars. They clattered through stations and

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: tunnel in which Henry had been shut up.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: Then they came to the top of the hill where Gordon had

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES

text: each other. "Go -- on! -- Go -- on!" And before his

author: REVEREND W AWDRY

author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: the hill, and were rattling and

author: REVEREND W AWDRY

text: Poor Thomas tried hard to stop

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: them from making him go too fast.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Stop pushing, stop pushing," he hissed, but the freight cars

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: "Go -- on! -- Go -- on!" they giggled in their silly way.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: He was glad when they got to the bottom. Then

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: he saw the place where they had to stop.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: They rattled through the station, and luckily the line was

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: clear as they swerved into the Freight Yard.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES
author: REVEREND W AWDRY
text: his brakes held fast and he skidded along the rails.

title: THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE: THE VERY FIRST STORIES

title: HELLO, ROCK

title: HELLO, ROCK

title: HELLO, ROCK

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: My dog is a big red dog.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Other kids I know have dogs, too.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: But I have the biggest, reddest dog on our street.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: We have fun together. We play games.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: I throw a stick, and he

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: and I don't need a tent.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He can sit up and beg.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Oh, I know he's not perfect.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: We don't go to the zoo anymore.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: It's not easy to keep Clifford.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG

text: He eats and drinks a lot.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: His house was a problem, too.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: But he's a very good watch dog.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: The bad boys don't come around anymore.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG

text: One day I gave Clifford a bath.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: and took him to the dog show.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: I'd like to say Clifford won first prize.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: You can keep all your small dogs.

title: CLIFFORD THE BIG RED DOG
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: This is Arthur. He is worried about his nose.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: They all love Arthur, and they all like his nose.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: One day Arthur decided he didn't like his nose. He had a cold and his nose was red. His sister thought his nose looked funny.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: His nose was a nuisance at school. Francine, who sat in front of Arthur, complained to the teacher that Arthur's nose was always bothering her.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: When Arthur played hide-and-seek, friends always found him first.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: His friends thought his nose was funny. But what could he do about it?

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: He could change his nose! That's what he could do about it.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: Arthur told his friends that he was going to the rhinologist for a new nose. His friends were very surprised.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: Doctor Louise was very helpful. She suggested that Arthur try on pictures of different noses. That way he could choose the one he liked best.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: Arthur tried on all kinds of noses.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: This was going to be a difficult decision.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: Arthur's friends waited outside to see which nose he would choose.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: [[I wonder what his new nose will look like? Do you think it will look better than mine?]]

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: [[I'm going to miss Arthur's old nose.]]

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: [[Maybe he won't want to play with us!]]

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: Arthur hadn't changed his nose at all.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: "I tried on every nose there was. I'm just not me without my nose!" said Arthur.

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: [[I still want to change my seat at school.]]

title: ARTHUR'S NOSE
author: MARC BROWN
text: There's a lot more to Arthur than his nose.

title: BIG RED BARN

title: BIG RED BARN

title: BIG RED BARN

title: BIG RED BARN

title: BIG RED BARN
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And the little donkey gave one last bray.

title: BIG RED BARN

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: The world of the color kittens.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Once there were two color kittens with green eyes.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Brush and Hush. They liked to mix and make colors

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: By splashing one color into another. They had buckets

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and buckets and buckets and buckets of color to

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: splash around with. Out of these colors they would

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: make all the colors in the world.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: The buckets had the colors written on them, but of

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: course the kittens couldn't read. They had to tell by

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: the colors. 'It is very easy,' said Brush.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: 'Red is red. Blue is blue,' said Hush.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: But they had no green. 'No green paint!'

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: said Brush and Hush. And they wanted green

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: paint, of course, because nearly every place

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: they liked to go was green.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: So they tried to make some green paint.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Brush mixed red paint and white paint to-

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: gether -and what did they make? It didn't

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Then Hush mixed yellow and red together, and it

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: The kittens were delighted, but it didn't

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Then they mixed red and blue together 

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and what did that make? It didn't make

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: green. It made a deep dark purple.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: O wonderful kittens! O Brush! O hush!

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: At last, almost by accident, the kittens

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: poured a bucket of blue and a bucket of

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: yellow together, and it came to pass that

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: they made a green as green as grass.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Green as green leaves on a tree

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Green as islands in the sea.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: The little kittens were so happy with all

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: the colors they had made that they began

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: to paint everything around them. They

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Then the kittens got so excited they

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: knocked their buckets upside down and all

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: the colors ran together. Yellow, red, a little

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: blue and a little black ... and that made

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And in all that brown, the sun went down.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: It was evening and the colors began to

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: disappear in the warm dark night.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: The kittens fell asleep in the warm dark

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: with all their colors out of sight and as

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: they slept they dreamed their dream.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And then a world of Easter eggs

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: That danced about on little short legs

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Till they all disappear in a soft gray fog.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And suddenly Brush woke up and Hush

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: woke up. It was morning. They crawled out of

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: bed into a big bright world. They sky was wild

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: The kittens were wild with purring and

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: They got so bouncy they knocked over the buckets

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and all the colors ran out together.

title: THE COLOR KITTENS
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: They were all the colors in the world and the color

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: You hold it in your hand,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: You can put it in your mouth,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: It is yellow in the middle,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: The important thing about rain is

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: It falls out of the sky,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and it does not taste like anything,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and is the color of air.

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: But the important thing about rain

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: about grass is that it is green.

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: But the important thing about grass

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: The important thing about snow is that it is white. It is

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: cold, and light, it falls softly

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: out of the sky, it is bright

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and the shape of tiny stars,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and crystals. It is always cold.

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: The important thing about an apple

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and the juice splashes in your face,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and it tastes like an apple,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and it falls off a tree.

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: an apple is that it is

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: about the sky is that it is always

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: there. It is true that it is blue,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and high, and full of clouds,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: the sky is that it is always there.

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: The important thing about a shoe

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: is that you put your foot in it.

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and you take it off at night,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and it's warm when you take it off.

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: But the important thing about a shoe

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: is that you put it on your foot.

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: The important thing about you is

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: It is true that you were a baby,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: and now you are a child,

title: THE IMPORTANT BOOK
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: But the most important thing about you

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: Katy was a beautiful red crawler tractor.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: She was very big and very strong

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: and she could do a lot of things.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: Katy also had a snow plow

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: Katy belonged to the Highway Department

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The Highway Department repaired the roads in the summer

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: and kept them clear of snow in the winter

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: so traffic could run in and out and around the city.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: All summer Katy worked on the roads

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The harder and tougher the job

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: Once when the steamroller fell in the pond

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The Highway Department was very proud of her.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: They used to say, 'Nothing can stop her.'

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: But Katy was so big and strong

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: she had to stay at home

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: because there was not enough snow for her to plow.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: Then early one morning it started to drizzle.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: By noon it was four inches deep.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The Highway Department sent out the truck plows.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: By afternoon the snow was ten inches deep

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: They said at the Highway Department,

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: One by one the truck snow plows broke down ....

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The schools, the stores, the factories were closed ....

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The railroad station and airport were snowed in ....

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The Police couldn't protect the city ....

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The telephone and power lines were down ...

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: There was a break in the water main ...

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The doctor couldn't get his patient to the hospital ...

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The City of Geoppolis was covered

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: with a thick blanket of snow.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: Katy started to plow out the city.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: 'Help us to get out to protect the city.'

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: So Katy plowed out to the center of a city.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: So Katy plowed down to the Railway Station.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: 'Help! Help!' called out the Telephone Company

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: 'The poles are down somewhere in East Geoppolis.'

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: So Katy plowed out the roads to Easy Geoppolis.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: called out the Superintendent of the Water Department.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: 'There's a break in the water main

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: And she plowed out the roads to North Geoppolis.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: 'Help me get this patient to the hospital

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: So Katy plowed out the roads to the hospital.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: 'Help! Help! Help!' called out the Fire Chief.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: 'There's a three alarm fire way out in South Geoppolis.'

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: So Katy plowed out the roads to the fire in South Geoppolis.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: On the way back a plane signaled for help.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: Katy was beginning to get a little tired

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: She hurried over to the airport

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: so the airplane could land safely.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: Then after she had found the broken down truck plows she started home.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The Fire Department had put out the fire.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The doctor had saved his patient.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The Water Department had repaired the main.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The telephone and electricity were on.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: The Police could protect the city.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: Katie finished up the side streets

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: So traffic could move in and out and around the city.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: Then she went home to rest.

title: KATY AND THE BIG SNOW
author: VIRGINIA LEE BURTON
text: Then... and only then did Katy stop.

title: FROM HEAD TO TOE
author: ERIC CARLE
text: I can do it! I can do it!

title: I AM A BIG SISTER!
author: CAROLINE JAYNE CHURCH
text: I'm a big sister now, hooray!

title: I AM A BIG SISTER!
author: CAROLINE JAYNE CHURCH
text: I can help when baby feeds.

title: I AM A BIG SISTER!
author: CAROLINE JAYNE CHURCH
text: And always find what baby needs.

title: I AM A BIG SISTER!
author: CAROLINE JAYNE CHURCH
text: Here's a clean one found by me!

title: I AM A BIG SISTER!
author: CAROLINE JAYNE CHURCH
text: Mommy and Daddy say I'm clever

title: I AM A BIG SISTER!
author: CAROLINE JAYNE CHURCH
text: and that I'm the best big sister ever!

title: I AM A BIG SISTER!
author: CAROLINE JAYNE CHURCH
text: When baby sleeps, shhh, no noise.

title: I AM A BIG SISTER!
author: CAROLINE JAYNE CHURCH
text: I quietly play with all my toys.

title: I AM A BIG SISTER!
author: CAROLINE JAYNE CHURCH
text: But if baby wakes with cranky cries,

title: I AM A BIG SISTER!
author: CAROLINE JAYNE CHURCH
text: And as baby grows, we'll play together.

title: I AM A BIG SISTER!
author: CAROLINE JAYNE CHURCH
text: Because I'm a big sister forever!

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: Sometimes being a girl isn't easy. At some

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: point, someone probably will tell you no, will

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: tell you to be quiet and may even tell you your

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: dreams are impossible. Don't listen to them.

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: These thirteen American women certainly did

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: born a slave, and her story could have ended

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: from slavery and becoming the most famous

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: She risked her life many times to lead

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: countless slaves to freedom, including her

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: family, friends, and strangers; every person

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: she led to freedom arrived safely.

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: 'I should fight for my liberty as long as my strength lasted.'

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: blind and deaf as a toddler, few people

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: thought she'd be able to learn to read, write

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: or speak. But she persisted. Helen learned

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: 'Young girls need to see role models in whatever careers they may choose, just so they can picture themselves doing those jobs someday.

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

text: visited her father in the Mojave Desert, he would

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

text: mean she is still the fastest woman ever.

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

author: CHELSEA CLINTON

author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: with a gavel in hand. She persisted, eventually

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: becoming a Supreme Court justice and the first-ever

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: 'I have never had to face anything that could overwhelm the native optimism and the stubborn perseverance I was blessed with.'

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: So, if anyone ever tells you no,

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON

title: SHE PERSISTED: 13 AMERICAN WOMEN WHO CHANGED THE WORLD
author: CHELSEA CLINTON
text: They persisted and so should you.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: Slow Loris lived in a zoo though he didn't care for it much.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: Slow Loris wasn't his real name but that was what everyone called him.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: A slow loris is just a type of animal.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: Slow Loris was a slow loris.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: It took Loris ten minutes to eat a satsuma...

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: twenty minutes to get from one end of his branch

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: and an hour to scratch his bottom.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: Most of the time though he just hung around, sleeping.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: The visitors all thought Loris was boring.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: The other animals thought so too.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: At night, when all the other animals were sound asleep,

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: Loris got up and did things...

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: Until he was so tired he couldn't do another thing.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: One night when Loris was busy doing particularly noisy things...

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: News of Loris's secret life spread quickly.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: Next evening the whole zoo gathered outside the slow loris cage.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: Sure enough, when it was really dark...

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: The other animals were amazed. Loris wasn't boring at all. He was really wild.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: That night they all did things together...

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: until they were all so tired, not one of them could do another thing.

title: SLOW LORIS
author: ALEXIS DEACON
text: The next day all the animals were slow. 'Boring,' said the visitors. But, like Loris, they didn't care, now they had a secret too.
