title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: For her pal to taken in:

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: Don't you think it's time to

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: Says the fish to his friend,

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: But it's just the way I am.

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: I wish you wouldn't greet us

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: With a grimace and a growl.'

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: Says the fish to his friend,

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: I'd like to be more friendly.

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: But it isn't up to me.

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: She is squirmy, she is squelchy,

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: A little joy? A little hope?'

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: Says the fish to his friend,

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: Take a look and you'll see why.

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: Let me tell it to you straight.

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: Says the fish to his friend,

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: I am destined to be glum.

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: The gang has never seen before

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: She plants a kiss upon his pout

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: He is stone-faced like a statue.

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: Then he blinks, and speaks at last:

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: 'I should have known it all along,

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: I thought that I was pouty,

title: THE POUT-POUT FISH
author: DEBORAH DIESEN
text: But it turns out I was wrong.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: [[To the love of my life, Dave...]]

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: [[proof that dreams really do come true.]]

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: The delicious smell of breakfast filled the air as Lucy's grandpa handed her a

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: plate. Lucy smeared ketchup on her toast. She turned to her grandpa and

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: said, 'Pap Gino, Harriet said she's never heard of ketchup on toast.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Her family uses butter and jelly.'

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'It's okay, not everyone likes the same thing, Lucy. It doesn't mean one person is

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: right or wrong. We're all different. What a boring world it would be if we were

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: all exactly alike! Do you remember what's really important?' Papa Gino asked.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'Yes, Papa. Even if we are different from others on the outside, we all have a

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: heart with feelings on the inside.'

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'That's my girl! Remember, when you treat others with love and kindness, you

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: are doing the right thing,' Pap Gino replied.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: On the school bus, Lucy and her friend Harriet pulled out some paper and

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: crayons. Sitting across from them was Ralph. As usual, Ralph sat alone, staring

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: out the window. He looked over at them and rolled his eyes.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: In the classroom, Lucy sat down near the teacher. Miss Marcia waited to begin

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: as the children settled into their seats. Ralph carelessly hurried over and tripped

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: on Lucy's foot. Before long, he was glaring at her.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Ralph whispered, 'Woof! I can't see the book with this poodle in front of

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: me.' Lucy could hear him giggling behind her. Oh no, why did it have to be

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: During lunch, Harriet shouted one of her silly jokes over the other children's

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: voices. As the girls ate, their bellies shook with laughter.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Across the table, Ralph hollered, 'Yuck. That's the disgusting smell.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Whoever heard of eating spaghetti in a hot dog bun? Don't you think

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Tony and the other children at the table turned away from Ralph, shaking their

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: heads. Ralph continued, 'Poor little Lucy with her hair so poofy!' Tears filled

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Lucy's eyes, and she began to cry.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: On the way home, Lucy thought about what had happened. Maybe Ralph is mean

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: to me because he thinks being different is bad. I wish he would stop teasing me.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Slowly, Lucy stepped off the bus. 'How was your day?' Papa Gino asked.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'Fine,' she mumbled. Papa reached over and pulled a crayon out of her hair.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'How did this happen?' he asked. Lucy didn't say a word.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: That night, as Papa Gino tucked Lucy into bed, he asked, 'Is everything all

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: right at school?' Lucy rolled over. He leaned down, kissed her on the cheek,

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: here for you. If something's not right, we

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: can work on fixing it together.'

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: It's not that easy, thought Lucy. How do I

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: stop Ralph from teasing me? How can he

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: have a heart and be so mean?

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Lucy had a hard time falling asleep, worrying what would happen tomorrow.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: The following day, Lucy was surprised to find Ralph leaving her alone, until...

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'Lucy, I'm sorry about yesterday,' Ralph snickered. Lucy took the bag Ralph

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: handed her. Inside were dog bones and a picture with a note that read:

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Lucy, Lucy, eats stinky food that puts us in a big, bad mood.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Lucy, Lucy, hair shaped like a cone, here's a treat for you-

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: The beating of Lucy's heart was so loud she knew everyone around her could

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: hear it. Her body began to tremble as she tore the note into pieces. 'Stop! It

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: hurts my feelings when you do this, Ralph,' Lucy said. 'Please stop!'  Ralph

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: It was recess time, and Lucy played alone. She didn't want to tell Miss Marcia

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: about Ralph. She was afraid of being a tattletale. Lucy wished Papa Gino was

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: there to help. What should I do? she asked herself over and over. The bell

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'Heeeeelllllppppp!' cried a child off in the distance. Tony ran up and yelled,

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'Ralph got himself stuck at the top of the monkey bars. It's the funniest thing

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'This is my chance, I'll go tell Ralph how mean he really is-M-E-A-N, mean!'

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Lucy said under her breath. She stomped off toward the monkey bars.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: When she reached Ralph, Lucy paused. She looked him in the eye and said,

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'What you did was so mean!' Standing before Ralph, Lucy could hear her

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: papa's words. Ralph did have a heart with feelings.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: In that moment, she decided what she would do. Lucy

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: started to climb up the monkey bars. She saw tears

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: in Ralph's eyes. He hesitated to move and whispered,

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'I'm scared.' Lucy reached for him and said, 'Here,

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: take my hand,' and she helped him down.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: The two walked back to the classroom without saying a word.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: On the way home, Lucy sang songs with Harriet. As the bus pulled up to her

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: stop, Ralph suddenly reached over and handed her a picture. Lucy was

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: amazed by what she saw. 'Thanks,' she muttered softly.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: After she got off the bus, Lucy reached for her papa's hand and said,

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: 'Papa, there's this boy Ralph who was really mean to me.

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Today he was in trouble, and I helped him.'

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: Papa Gino hugged Lucy and replied, 'That took a lot of courage. It wasn't the

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: easiest thing to do. You chose to be a good person and to treat others the way

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: you want to be treated. I'm so proud of you, Lucy.'

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: As they walked home, she asked him what was for dinner. When Papa Gino said

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: spaghetti, Lucy knew immediately what she would have for lunch the next day...

title: SPAGHETTI IN A HOT DOG BUN: HAVING THE COURAGE TO BE WHO YOU ARE
author: MARIA DISMONDY
text: her favorite sandwich, spaghetti in a hot dog bun.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: A mouse took a stroll through the deep dark wood.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: A fox saw the mouse and the mouse looked good.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'Where are you going to, little brown mouse?

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Come and have lunch in my underground house.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'It's terribly kind of you, Fox, but no 

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: I'm going to have lunch with a gruffalo.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And terrible teeth in his terrible jaws.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And his favourite food is roasted fox.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'Goodbye, little mouse,' and away he sped.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: There's no such thing as a gruffalo?'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: On went the mouse through the deep dark wood.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: An owl saw the mouse and the mouse looked good.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'Where are you going to, little brown mouse?

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Come and have tea in my treetop house.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'It's frightfully nice of you. Owl, but no 

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: I'm going to have tea with a gruffalo.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And a poisonous wart at the end of his nose.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And his favourite food is owl ice cream.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Goodbye, little mouse,' and away Owl flew.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: There's no such thing as a gruffalo?'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: On went the moues through the deep dark wood.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: A snake saw the mouse and the mouse looked good.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'Where are you going to, little brown mouse?

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Come for a feast in my logpile house.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'It's wonderfully good of you, Snake but no 

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: I'm having a feast with a gruffalo.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: He has purple prickles all over his back.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And his favourite food is scrambled snake.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Goodbye, little mouse,' and away Snake slid.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'There's no such thing as a gruffal

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: But who is this creature with terrible claws

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And terrible teeth in his terrible jaws?

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: He has knobbly knees and turned-out toes

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And a poisonous wart at the end of his nose.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: His eyes are orange, his tongue is black;

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: He has purple prickles all over his back.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'You'll taste good on a slice of bread!'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'Good?' said the mouse. 'Don't call me good!

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: I'm the scariest creature in this wood.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Just walk behind me and soon you'll see,

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'All right,' said the Gruffalo, bursting with laughter.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'You go ahead and I'll follow after.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: They walked and walked till the Gruffalo said,

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'I hear a hiss in the leaves ahead.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'It's Snake,' said the mouse. 'Why, Snake, hello!'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Snake took one look at the Gruffalo.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And off he slid to his logpile house.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'You see?' said the mouse. 'I told you so.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: They walked some more till the Gruffalo said,

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'I hear a hoot in the trees ahead.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'It's Owl,' said the mouse. 'Why, Owl, hello!'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Owl took one look at the Gruffalo.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And off he flew to his treetop house.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'You see?' said the mouse. 'I told you so.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: They walked some more till the Gruffalo said,

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: 'I can hear feet on the path ahead.'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Fox took one look at the Gruffalo.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And off he ran to his underground house.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Well, Gruffalo,' said the mouse. 'You see?

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: But now my tummy's beginning to rumble.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: My favourite food is gruffalo crumble!'

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And quick as the wind he turned and fled.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: All was quiet in the deep dark wood.

title: THE GRUFFALO
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The mouse found a nut and the nut was good.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The Gruffalo said that no Gruffalo should

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: ever set foot in the deep dark wood.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "Because if you do, the Big Bad Mouse will be after you.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: I met him once," said the Gruffalo.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "I met him a long, long time ago."

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "What does he look like? Tell me, Dad.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Is he terribly big and terribly bad?"

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "I can't quite remember," the Gruffalo said.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Then he thought for a minute and scratched his head.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "The Big Bad Mouse is terribly strong

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: and his scaly tail is terribly long.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: His eyes are like pools of terrible fire

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And his terrible whiskers are tougher than wire."

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: One snowy night when the Gruffalo snored,

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The Gruffalo's Child was feeling bored.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The Gruffalo's Child was feeling brave

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: so she tiptoed out of the gruffalo cave.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The snow fell fast and the wind blew wild.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Into the wood went the Gruffalo's Child.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Aha! Oho! A trail in the snow!

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Whose is this trail and where does it go?

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: A tail poked out of a logpile house.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Could this be the tail of the Big Bad Mouse?

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Out slid the creature. His eyes were small

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And he didn't have whiskers- no, none at all.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "He's down by the lake- eating gruffalo cake."

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The snow fell fast and the wind blew wild.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "I'm not scared," said the Gruffalo's child.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Aha! Oho! Marks in the snow!

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Whose are these claw marks? Where do they go?

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Two eyes gleamed out of a treetop house.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Could these be the eyes of the Big Bad Mouse?

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Down flew the creature. His tail was short

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: And he didn't have whiskers of any sort.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: But he's somewhere nearby, eating gruffalo pie."

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The snow fell fast and the wind blew wild.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "I'm not scared," said the Gruffalo's Child.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Aha! Oho! A track in the snow!

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Whose is this track and where does it go?

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Whiskers at last! And an underground house!

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: (Could this be the home of the Big Bad Mouse?)

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Out slunk a creature. His eyes weren't fiery.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: His tail wasn't scaly. His whiskers weren't wiry.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: He's under a tree- drinking Gruffalo tea."

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "It's all a trick!" said the Gruffalo's Child

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: as she sat on a stump where the snow lay piled.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "I don't believe in the Big Bad Mouse-

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: But here comes a little one, out of his house!

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Not big, not bad, but a mouse at least-

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: You'll taste good as a midnight feast."

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: There's a friend of mine that you ought to meet.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: If you let me hop onto a hazel twig

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: I'll beckon my friend so bad and big."

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The Gruffalo's Child unclenched her fist.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "The Big Bad Mouse- so he does exist!"

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The mouse hopped into the hazel tree.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: He beckoned and said, "Just wait and see."

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Out came the moon. It was bright and round.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: A terrible shadow fell onto the ground.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Who is this creature so big, bad and strong?

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: His tail and his whiskers are terribly long.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: His ears are enormous, and over his shoulder

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: he carries a nut as big as a boulder!

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: "The Big Bad Mouse!" yelled the Gruffalo's child.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The mouse jumped down from the twig and smiled.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Aha! Oho! Prints in the snow.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: Whose are these footprints? Where do they go?

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The footprints led to the gruffalo cave,

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: where the Gruffalo's Child was a bit less brave.

title: THE GRUFFALO'S CHILD
author: JULIA DONALDSON
text: The Gruffalo's Child was a bit less bored-

title: GO, DOG. GO!
author: P.D. EASTMAN
text: for all dogs to get up.

title: GO, DOG. GO!
author: P.D. EASTMAN
text: What are they going to do?

title: GO, DOG. GO!
author: P.D. EASTMAN
text: They are all going to that

title: GO, DOG. GO!
author: P.D. EASTMAN
text: Now all the dogs get out.

title: GO, DOG. GO!
author: P.D. EASTMAN
text: To the tree! To the tree!

title: GO, DOG. GO!
author: P.D. EASTMAN
text: Up the tree! Up the tree!

title: GO, DOG. GO!
author: P.D. EASTMAN
text: to the top of the tree.

title: GO, DOG. GO!
author: P.D. EASTMAN
text: are all at a dog party!

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time for bed, little mouse, little mouse,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: Darkness is falling over the house.

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time for bed, little goose, little goose,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: The stars are out and on the loose.

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time for bed, little cat, little cat,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: So snuggle in tight, that's right, like that.

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time for bed, little calf, little calf,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: What happened today that made you laugh?

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time for bed, little foal, little foal,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: I'll whisper a secret, but don't tell a soul.

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time for bed, little fish, little fish,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: So hold your breath and make a wish.

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time for bed, little sheep, little sheep,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: The whole wide world is going to sleep.

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time to sleep, little bird, little bird,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: So close your eyes, not another word.

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time to sleep, little bee, little bee,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: Yes, I love you and you love me.

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time to sleep, little snake, little snake,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: Good gracious me, you're still awake!

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time to sleep, little pup, little pup,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: If you don't sleep soon the sun will be up!

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: It's time to sleep, little deer, little deer,

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: The very last kiss is almost here.

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: The stars on high are shining bright-

title: TIME FOR BED
author: MEM FOX
text: Sweet dreams, my darling, sleep well...

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: Night: Ate grass. Decided grass is boring.

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: Scratched. Hard to reach the itchy bits.

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: Began new hole in soft dirt.

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: Evening: Someone has filled in my new hole.

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: New hole hilled up with water.

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: Never knew there were so many carrots in the world.

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: Night: Offered carrots at the back door.

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: Why would I want carrots when I feel like rolled oats?

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: Demanded rolled oats instead. Humans failed

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: Am constantly amazed how dumb humans can be.

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: Chewed up one pair of boots, three cardboard boxes,

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: eleven flowerpots and a garden chair

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: my nose on my way to the back door.

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: Only had to bash the rubbish bin

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: for five minutes before they arrived.

title: DIARY OF A WOMBAT
author: JACKIE FRENCH
text: are easily trained and make quite good pets.

title: MILLIONS OF CATS

text: was a very old man and

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: the door was. But they couldn't

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: 'If we only had a cat!' sighed the very

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: 'A cat?' asked the very old man.

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: 'Yes, a sweet little fluffy cat,' said

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: 'I will get you a cat, my dear,'

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: And he set out over the hills to look for

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: one. He climbed over the sunny hills. He

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: trudged through the cool valleys. He walked

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: a long, long time and at last he came to a

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: hill which was a quite covered with cats.

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: Millions and billions and trillions of cats.

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: just as pretty as the first.

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: So he took this one also.

title: MILLIONS OF CATS
author: WANDA GAG
text: But then he saw a fuzzy grey

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: If his cookie had half as many chocolate

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: chips as his sister's, LOOK OUT!

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET

text: If he lost his turn during a game,

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: 'Sorry, Melvin, they were out of dinosaur backpacks.'

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: No, Melvin did NOT deal well

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: And this is why he HATED

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: and you don't throw a FIT.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: Because of this rule, Melvin could not throw a

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: fit if he had to use crayons instead of markers.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: He could not throw a fit if he ended up last in line.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: He couldn't even throw a fit if his napkin

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: 'Oh, well,' mumbled Melvin, 'at least I can still

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: throw a fit at home. My family doesn't know

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: a thing about that TERRIBLE rule.'

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: But that night when it was Melvin's turn to choose the movie,

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: things changed. As soon as he'd chosen Dinosaur Rumble, his

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: sister stomped her food and whined.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: 'TOO BAD! You get what you get,

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: and you don't throw a fit,' said Melvin.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: Everyone stopped and looked at Melvin.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: 'You get what you get, and you

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: don't throw a fit,' repeated Melvin.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET

text: 'So if your cookie only has a few chocolate chips,

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: you shouldn't throw a fit?' asked his sister.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: you shouldn't throw a fit?' asked his dad.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: you should be happy with the robot one, and you

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: absolutely should not throw a fit?' asked his mom.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: Melvin gulped. There was no way to take it back.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: 'Well, I mean, at school you shouldn't throw a fit,

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: cause that's the rule. But at home, you can,' he said.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: 'I think that sounds like a good rule for at home, too,' said Dad.

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET

text: 'Home and school, that's the rule!' his sister chanted.

text: He wanted to lie down on the

title: YOU GET WHAT YOU GET
author: JULIE GASSMAN
text: After all, you get what you get,

title: I LOVE MY MOMMY BECAUSE

text: I love my mommy, and my mommy loves me.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: One windy afternoon in Adventure Bay, a box moved

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: down the street toward Katie's Pet Parlor. But this box

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: wasn't being blown by the wind. It was creeping down

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Suddenly, a big gust blew the box away, revealing

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Skye and Rubble underneath. They quickly scampered

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Inside, Ryder, Katie, and Rocky were getting

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: ready for Chase's surprise birthday party.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'Who's making sure Chase doesn't surprise us

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: while we set up?' Skye asked.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'Marshall,' Rocky said. 'He can keep a secret-

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Across town, Marshall and Chase were playing in

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Pup Park. They swung on the swings and slid down

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'Maybe we should go find Ryder and the pups,'

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Just then, the wind picked up again and blew them

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Back at the Pet Parlor, the lights suddenly went

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'All the lights on the street are out!' Rocky

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Ryder thought he knew what was wrong.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: The team raced to the Lookout. But without

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: electricity, the doors wouldn't open. Luckily,

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Rocky had a screwdriver, which did the trick.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Once they were inside, Ryder used his

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: telescope to check Adventure Bay's windmills.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'Just as I thought,' he said. 'The wind broke

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: a propeller. Since the windmill can't turn, it can't

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: make electricity. We need to fix it!'

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Ryder looked at Rocky. 'We'll need something

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: from your truck to fix the broken blade.'

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'We'll need Marshall's ladder to climb up and

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'Chase, the traffic lights won't work without

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: electricity,' Ryder continued 'I need you to use

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: your siren and megaphone to direct traffic.'

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Meanwhile, Skye, Zuma, and Rubble raced

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: back to the Pet Parlor to continue setting up for

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Chase's surprise party. It was very dark, but Katie

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: At the center of town, Chase busily directed traffic.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'You're our hero,' Mayor Goodway said as she

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'I'm just doing my PAW Patrol duty,' Chase said.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Up in the hills, Ryder, Marshall, and Rocky went

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: to work on the broken windmill. Ryder climbed

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Marshall's ladder and removed the old blade

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: while Rocky looked for a replacement piece.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'No, not a tire... not a lawn chair,' Rocky

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: said, pulling stuff out of his truck. At last he found

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: what he wanted. 'Here it is-my old surfboard!

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: This surfboard will catch a breeze and help

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: turn it into electricity,' Rocky said as he bolted

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: the board into place. The wind picked up and the

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: windmill started to turn. Lights came on all over

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: The traffic lights started working again.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'Ryder and the PAW Patrol did it!' Chase

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: The lights in the Pet Parlor glowed brightly.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: frowned. 'Aw! There's no time to make a cake.'

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Katie thought for a moment. 'I have an idea!'

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: As Chase drove back to the

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: lookout, he got a call from Ryder.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: chase stepped inside. The lights went on

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: Chase was amazed. 'Wow! You guys turned

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: the lights back on AND made a party for me?'

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: 'We didn't have time to bake you a real cake,' Katie

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: said, 'so we hope you like your pup-treat cookie cake.'

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: for help!' Ryder said with a laugh.

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: All the puppies cheered and enjoyed

title: PUPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU! (PAW PATROL)
author: GOLDEN BOOKS (PUBLISHER)
text: a taste of Chase's special cake.

text: Hi! My name is Phoebe! I like tummy

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY

text: More than anything, though, I love my

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: family. The day I met them was the very

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: best day of my entire life.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: My sister, The Girl with the Curly Hair,

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: walked right over to me. Our eyes met.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: We both smiled. When she scratched my

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: tummy, my pink tail started swishing so

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: fast. We were best friends at first sight.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: So now I live with my family, and every day is

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: a new adventure. Each morning starts with me

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: watching Dad, The Man with the Beard,

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: I'm pretty sure I could be very good at sports!

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: That's my brother, The Baby, over there.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: He's really the boss around here. Every time

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: he makes a sound, Mom, The Lady Who

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: Feeds Me, rushes to his side.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: My brother rolls from his tummy to his

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: back. I could do that a million times! But

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: when my brother does it, Mom cheers and

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: When my brother starts walking and

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: talking, running and jumping, he can play

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: My favorite time of day is when my sister

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: comes home from school. I wait for her, and

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: when she gets off the bus, she always throws

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: a ball for me to catch.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: Then it's snack time! I like to lick

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: the crumbs from her fingers, and

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: when I roll over, she gives me a treat.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: There are some kids playing soccer nearby.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: I have learned all about soccer from

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: watching The Man with the Beard in his

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: box, so I join right in.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: and all the while see my sister laughing

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: I run straight out to my sister and

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: pick up the football. Our eyes meet.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: I guess you could say we both

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: know she is ready to give it a try.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: One of the kids throws the ball,

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: and my sister catches it! She starts

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: to run, and everyone chases her.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: Then, just as she is about to score

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: she trips, falls flat on her face, and drops

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: the ball. It just slips out of her hands.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: The Girl with the Curly Hair looks like

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: she might cry. I know what I have to do.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: It is time for me to save the day.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: I run forward and back. I score a

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: All the boys and girls are chasing

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: me and laughing, except my sister.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: She is still sitting where she fell,

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: Then one of the boys yells

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: help us get the ball back?

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: She smiles and calls my name. I run

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: straight toward her, and just as I am about

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: to jump into her lap...¦ a squirrel runs by.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: Did I forget to mention I love chasing

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: When the squirrel runs up a tree, the

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: kids and I fall to the ground, tired from

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: running so fast and laughing so hard.

title: MVP: MOST VALUABLE PUPPY
author: MIKE GREENBERG & STACY STEPONATE GREENBERG
text: Will you come back and play

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: It's time to stretch from small to tall

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: To see the moon so bright.

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: It lights our way and seems to say,

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: Was that a little growl I heard?

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: Let's get a snack then hit the sack.

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: Who's ready for a bedtime bath?

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: I filled the tub, so scrub-a-dub.

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: Now get yourself all dressed for bed.

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: You're oh-so-sweet from head to feet-

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: Come climb up here on Mama's lap

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT

text: And read a book with me.

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: I know one that's lots of fun.

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT

text: I'll wrap you safely in my arms

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: There's nothing more that I adore

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: Let's settle down and settle in

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: And close our eyes to pray.

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: You've wrestled, raced, and run and chased.

author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT

text: Who, who should choose the song?

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL
text: There's one I love bout God above,

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT
author: HANNAH HALL

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT

text: You're ready now to cuddle down.

text: I'll hold you near so you can hear

title: GOD BLESS YOU AND GOOD NIGHT

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Rocket loved to play. He loved

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: to chase leaves and chew sticks. He

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: also loved to listen to the birds sing.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Every autumn morning, after chasing leaves,

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Rocket would lie down in his favorite spot under

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: his favorite tree. There he would sniff the neighborhood

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: smells and settle in for a good nap.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: But one day ... a little yellow bird startled Rocket.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: 'Aha! My first student! Wonderful!' she sang.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Rocket was confused. 'Student? I'm not a '

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: 'But if I am you teacher,' the bird interrupted,'

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: then you must be my student.'

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Rocket found it hard to argue with the bird.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: 'I am so glad you saw my sign,' the bird chirped.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: 'Oh, yes, I can see it,' Rocket said. 'But I don't know how to read.'

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: 'Can't read? Fantastic!' She waved a wing. 'Welcome to my classroom.'

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: But I just came here to nap,' Rocket said.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: 'No, no! There will be no napping in class,' declared the bird. 'Except of

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: 'Well, then, I can take a nap over

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: here,' said Rocket. 'I've had a very

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: [[Aa Bb Cc Dd Ee Ff Gg Hh Ii Jj Kk Ll Mm Nn Oo Pp Qq Rr Ss Tt Uu Vv Ww Xx Yy Zz]]

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: As Rocket breathed in the crisp air, the little yellow

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: bird hung her banner. 'Ah, the wonderous, mighty

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: gorgeous alphabet,' she marveled. 'Where it all begins.'

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Opening up a book, the bird began to

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: read. She sang the story of an unlucky dog

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: named Buster who'd lost his favorite bone.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: A cool breeze carried his lively voice across

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: the yard. At first Rocket was disturbed.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: But before long, he found himself

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: To Rocket the story was as

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: delicious as the earthly smells of

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: fall. It was as exciting as chasing

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: the lilac bush,' the bird read,

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Was it the bone? he wondered.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: But the little yellow bird was gone.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: The next morning Rocket arrived early.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: At last the little yellow bird appeared. 'Hello? How

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: wonderful to see you in class,' she chirped. 'I can tell by your

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: waggy tail that you are well rested.''

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: 'I'd like to hear the end of the story, please,' said Rocket.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: 'That seems like a fine way to start the day,' chirped the bird.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: She gave Rocket a name tag and began to read.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Together they sound out the sounds that each

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: With a G and many Rs they spelt

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Soon they spelled the sound of the wind, which was growing colder by the day.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Soon they were spelling words like F-A-L-L for the gusty

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Time of year, and R-E-D for the color of the leaves.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: And each afternoon the bird read a story. She read stories

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: about dogs and birds. She read about leaves changing colors and

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: about birds flying south for the winter.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Then one day, the weather turned and

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: 'See you again in the glorious spring,'

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: And as she flew into the wintry sky, she

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: called, 'Don't forget! Words are built one

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: the leaves fell from the trees.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: bird's alphabet and practiced his letters.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: He thought about the bird's sweet chirp while

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: He made new friends and spelled their names.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: When Rocket spelled M-U-D, he knew that spring

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: as it always does, had returned.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: The breeze blew warmer, the grass

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: grew greener, and a sign appeared.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Early the next morning, Rocket rushed to his classroom. As he

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: you. I can tell by your waggy tail

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: that you are ready for class.'

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: Then together they began to read. They read stories about

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: birds flying north in the spring. They read about picnics in

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: the warm sun. And they read about Buster, the lucky dog who

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: found his bone under the lilac bush.

title: HOW ROCKET LEARNED TO READ
author: TAD HILLS
text: And when they were finished, they read it again.

author: MEM FOX AND JUDY HORACEK
text: And here is the red sheep.

author: MEM FOX AND JUDY HORACEK

author: MEM FOX AND JUDY HORACEK
text: And here is the slide sheep.

title: WHERE IS THE GREEN SHEEP?
author: MEM FOX AND JUDY HORACEK
text: and here is the down sheep.

title: WHERE IS THE GREEN SHEEP?
author: MEM FOX AND JUDY HORACEK
text: And here is the clown sheep.

title: WHERE IS THE GREEN SHEEP?
author: MEM FOX AND JUDY HORACEK
text: And here is the rain sheep.

title: WHERE IS THE GREEN SHEEP?
author: MEM FOX AND JUDY HORACEK
text: and here is the train sheep.

title: WHERE IS THE GREEN SHEEP?
author: MEM FOX AND JUDY HORACEK
text: And here is the wave sheep.

title: WHERE IS THE GREEN SHEEP?
author: MEM FOX AND JUDY HORACEK

author: MEM FOX AND JUDY HORACEK

title: WHERE IS THE GREEN SHEEP?
author: MEM FOX AND JUDY HORACEK
