title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: [["I have found a kernel of wheat," said the Little Red Hen. "Now who will help me plant this wheat? Where is that lazy dog? Where is that lazy cat? Where is that lazy mouse?"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Wait a minute. Hold everything. You can't tell your story right here. This is the endpaper. The book hasn't even started yet."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Who are you? Will you help me plant the wheat?"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I'm Jack. I'm the narrator. And no, I can't help you plant the wheat. I'm a very busy guy trying to put a book together. Now why don't you just disappear for a few pages. I'll call you when I need you."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "But who will help me tell my story? Who will help me draw a picture of the wheat? Who will help me spell 'the wheat'?"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Listen Hen - forget the wheat. Here comes the Title Page!"]]

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: [[A long time ago, people used to tell magical stories of wonder and enchantment. Those stories were called Fairy Tales. Those stories are not in this book. The stories in this book are almost Fairy Tales. But not quite. The stories in this book are Fairly Stupid Tales. I mean, what else would you call a story like "Goldilocks and the Three Elephants"? This girl walking through the woods smells Peanut Porridge cooking. She decides to break into the Elephants' house, eat the porridge, sit in the chairs, and sleep in the beds. But when she gets in the house she can't climb up on Baby Elephant's chair because it's too big. She can't climb up on Mama Elephant's chair because it's much too big. And she can't climb up on Papa Elephant's chair because it's much much too big. So she goes home. The End.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: And if you don't think that's fairly stupid, you should read "Little Red Running Shorts" or maybe "The Stinky Cheese Man." In fact, you should definitely go read the stories now, because the rest of this introduction just kind of goes on and on and doesn't really say anything. I stuck it on to the end here so it would fill up the page and make it look like I really knew what I was talking about. So stop now. I mean it. Quit reading. Turn the page. If you read this last sentence, it won't tell you anything.]]

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: [[SURGEON GENERAL'S WARNING: It has been determined that these tales are fairly stupid and probably dangerous to your health.]]

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Once upon a time Chicken Licken was standing around when a piece of something fell on her head. She wasn't the brightest thing on two legs, so she started running around in circles clucking, "The sky is falling! The sky is falling! We must tell the President!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Chicken Licken ran to her friend Ducky Lucky and clucked, "Ducky Lucky! Ducky Lucky! The sky is falling! The sky is falling! We must tell the President!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Chicken Licken and Ducky Lucky ran to their friend Goosey Loosey and yelled, "Goosey Loosey! Goosey Loosey! The sky is falling! The sky is falling! We must tell the President!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Chicken Licken, Ducky Lucky, and Goosey Loosey ran to their friend Cocky Locky and yelled, "Cocky Locky! Cocky Locky! The sky is falling! The sky is falling! We must tell the President!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Wait a minute! Wait a minute!" cried Jack the Narrator. "I forgot the Table of Contents! I forgot the Table of Contents!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Hey, you're not in this story," said Chicken Licken.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I know," said Jack the Narrator. "But I came to warn you. The Table of Contents is -"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "The sky is falling! The sky is falling!" clucked Chicken Licken. "We must tell the President!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: So Chicken Licken, Ducky Lucky, Goosey Loosey, and Cocky Locky ignored Jack the Narrator and ran off to catch a plane to Washington.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Just outside the airport they met Foxy Loxy.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Foxy Loxy! Foxy Loxy! The sky is falling! The sky is falling! We must tell the President!" yelled Chicken Licken, Ducky Lucky, Goosey Loosey, and Cocky Locky.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Well, come with me," said Foxy Loxy. "I know a shortcut to the airport."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Foxy Loxy led Chicken Licken, Ducky Lucky, Goosey Loosey, and Cocky Locky to his cave. He didn't get to eat them though, because Chicken Licken was almost right.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The Table of Contents was. It fell and squashed everybody. The End.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The Princess and the Bowling Ball

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Once upon a time there was a Prince. And this Prince's dad and mom (the King and Queen) somehow got it into their royal heads that no Princess would be good enough for their boy unless she could feel a pea through one hundred mattresses.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: So it should come as no surprise that the Prince had a very hard time finding a Princess. Every time he met a nice girl, his mom and dad would pile one hundred mattresses on top of a pea and then invite her to sleep over.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: When the Princess came down for breakfast, the Queen would ask, "How did you sleep, dear?"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The Princess would politely say, "Fine, thank you."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: And the King would show her the door.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Now this went on for three years. And of course nobody ever felt the pea under one hundred mattresses. Then one day the Prince met the girl of his dreams. He decided he better do something about it. That night, before the Princess went to bed, the Prince slipped his bowling ball under the one hundred mattresses.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: When the Princess came down for breakfast the next morning, the Queen asked, "How did you sleep, dear?"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "This might sound odd," said the Princess. "But I think you need another mattress. I felt like I was sleeping on a lump as big as a bowling ball."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The King and Queen were satisfied.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The Prince and Princess were married.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: And everyone lived happily, though maybe not completely honestly, ever after. The End.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Once upon a time there was a mother duck and a father duck who had seven baby ducklings. Six of them were regular-looking ducklings. The seventh was a really ugly duckling.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Everyone used to say, "What a nice-looking bunch of ducklings - all except that one. Boy, he's really ugly."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The really ugly duckling heard these people, but he didn't care. He knew that one day he would probably grow up to be a swan and be bigger and look better than anything in the pond.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Well, as it turned out, he was just a really ugly duckling. And he grew up to be just a really ugly duck. The End.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I planted the wheat. I watered the wheat. I harvested the wheat. Now do I get to tell my story?" said the Little Red Hen. "Say, what's going on here? Why is that page blank? Is that my page? Where is that lazy dog? Where is that lazy cat? Where is that lazy mouse? How do they expect me to tell the whole story by myself? Where is that lazy narrator? Where is that lazy illustrator? Where is that lazy author?"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Once upon a time there was a frog.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: One day when he was sitting on his lily pad, he saw a beautiful princess sitting by the pond. He hopped in the water, swam over to her, and poked his head out of the weeds.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Pardon me, O beautiful princess," he said in his most sad and pathetic voice. "I wonder if you could help me."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The princess was about to jump up and run, but she felt sorry for the frog with the sad and pathetic voice.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: So she asked, "What can I do to help you, little frog?"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Well," said the frog. "I'm not really a frog, but a handsome prince who was turned into a frog by a wicked witch's spell. And the spell can only be broken by the kiss of a beautiful princess."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The princess thought about this for a second, then lifted the frog from the pond and kissed him.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I was just kidding," said the frog. He jumped back into the pond and the princess wiped the frog slime off her lips. The End.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Okay, I've got things running smoothly now," said Jack the Narrator. "And this next story is even better than the last three. See, it's about this girl who runs very fast and always wears red running shorts. That's where her name comes from, get it? So anyway, this girl is running to her granny's house where she meets a wolf. He tricks her into taking the long way while he takes the shortcut. Now this is the good part because Red runs so fast that she beats the wolf to granny's house. He knocks on the door. Red answers it. And guess what she says? 'My, what slow feet you have.' And that's it. The End. Is that great or what? So sit back, relax, and enjoy - 'Little Red Running Shorts.'"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "And now, like I already said - 'Little Red Running Shorts.'"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "You just told the whole story," says Little Red Running Shorts. "We're not going to tell it again.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "You can't say that," says Jack. "You have to start with 'Once upon a time.'"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "No way," says the wolf. "You blew it."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "But you guys are next. Look at the title at the top of the page - 'Little Red Running Shorts.' That's you."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Let's go, Wolf. We're out of here."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Wait. You can't do this. Your story is supposed to be three pages long. What do I do when we turn the page?"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Forget that Hen. Now it's time for the best story in the whole book - my story. Because Once Upon a Time I traded our last cow for three magic beans and...¦ hey, Giant. What are you doing down here? You're wrecking my whole story."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I DON'T LIKE THAT STORY," said the Giant. "YOU ALWAYS TRICK ME."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "FEE FI FUM FORY. I HAVE MADE MY OWN STORY."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Great rhyme, Giant. And I'm sure your story is just as good. But there's no room for it. So why don't you climb back up the beanstalk. I'll be up in a few minutes to steal your gold and your singing harp."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I'LL GRIND YOUR BONES TO MAKE MY BREAD."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I knew you'd understand. And there's another little thing that's been bugging me. Could you please stop talking in uppercase letters? It really messes up the page."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I WILL READ MY STORY NOW," said the Giant. And he did.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: [[for a spell had been cast by a Wicked Witch]]

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "That's your story?" said Jack. "You've got to be kidding. That's not a Fairly Stupid Tale. That's an Incredibly Stupid Tale. That's an Unbelievably Stupid Tale. That is the Most Stupid Tale I Ever - awwwk!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The Giant grabbed Jack and dragged him to the next page.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Once upon a time there was a Giant. The Giant squeezed Jack and said, "TELL ME A BETTER STORY OR I WILL GRIND YOUR BONES TO MAKE MY BREAD. AND WHEN YOUR STORY IS FINISHED, I WILL GRIND YOUR BONES TO MAKE MY BREAD ANYWAY! HO, HO, HO." The Giant laughed an ugly laugh. Jack thought, "He'll kill me if I do. He'll kill me if I don't. There's only one way to get out of this." Jack cleared his throat, and then began his story.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Or the Girl Who Really Blew It

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Once upon a time there was a beautiful girl named Cinderella who lived with her wicked stepmother and two ugly stepsisters. These steprelatives were not only wicked and ugly - they also made Cinderella clean the house every day.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: One day the local prince announced that he was holding a fabulous ball at his castle. Everyone was invited.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The stepmother and stepsisters got all dressed up to go. But, as usual, they made Cinderella clean the house, so she didn't have time to get ready. After the stepmother and stepsisters left for the ball, Cinderella sat down and began to cry.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Just then a little man appeared.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Please don't cry," he said. "I can help you spin straw into gold."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I don't think that will do me much good," said Cinderella. "I need a fancy dress, glass slippers, and a coach."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Would you like to try to guess my name?" said the clever little man.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Cinderella looked at him. "No. Not really."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "If you don't have a dress, it doesn't really matter."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Oh, just guess a name, any name."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I'm not supposed to talk to strangers," said Cinderella. Then she closed the door and left the little man standing outside screaming, "RUMPELSTILTSKIN! RUMPELSTILTSKIN! RUMPELSTILTSKIN!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: When the stepmother and stepsisters got home from the ball, Cinderella told them about the strange little man. They still made her clean the house. And meaner still, they changed her name to Cinderumpelstiltskin. The End.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Once upon a time there was a Tortoise who was very slow but very dependable.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: He would always get where he set out to go.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: It just took him longer than most people.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: One day Rabbit saw Tortoise walking slowly but surely down the road and said, "Tortoise, you are so slow. I could probably grow hair faster than you run."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: One the day of the big race Tortoise and Rabbit lined up at the starting line.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Owl said, "On your mark. Get set. Grow!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Rabbit started to grow his hair.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Tortoise ran. Rabbit grew his hair. Tortoise ran. Rabbit grew his hair. Tortoise ran. Rabbit grew his hair. Tortoise ran. Rabbit grew his hair. Tortoise ran. Rabbit grew his hair. Tortoise ran. Rabbit grew his hair. Tortoise is still running. Rabbit is still growing his hair. Not The End.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Once upon a time there was a little old woman and a little old man who lived together in a little old house. They were lonely. So the little old lady decided to make a man out of stinky cheese. She gave him a piece of bacon for a mouth and two olives for eyes and put him in the oven to cook.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: When she opened the oven to see if he was done, the smell knocked her back.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Phew! What is that terrible smell?" she cried. The Stinky Cheese Man hopped out of the oven and ran out the door calling, "Run run run as fast as you can. You can't catch me. I'm the Stinky Cheese Man!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The little old lady and the little old man sniffed the air.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I'm not really very hungry," said the little old man.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I'm not really all that lonely," said the little old lady. So they didn't chase the Stinky Cheese Man. The Stinky Cheese Man ran and ran until he met a cow eating grass in a field. "Wow! What's that awful smell?" said the cow.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The Stinky Cheese Man said, "I've run away from a little old lady and a little old man and I can run away from you too I can. Run run run as fast as you can. You can't catch me. I'm the Stinky Cheese Man!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The cow gave another sniff and said, "I'll bet you could give someone two or three stomachaches. I think I'll just eat weeds."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: So the cow didn't chase the stinky cheese man either.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The Stinky Cheese Man ran and ran until he met some kids playing outside school.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Gross," said a little girl. "What's that nasty smell?"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "I've run away from a little old lady, and a little old man, and a cow, and I can run away from you too I can. Run run run as fast as you can. You can't catch me. I'm the Stinky Cheese Man!"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: A little boy looked up, sniffed the air and said, "If we catch him, our teacher will probably make us eat him. Let's get out of here."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: So the kids didn't chase the Stinky Cheese Man either.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: By and by the Stinky Cheese Man came to a river with no bridge.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "How will I ever cross this river? It's too big to jump, and if I try to swim across I'll probably fall apart," said You-Know-Who.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Just then the sly fox (who shows up in a lot of stories like these) poked his head out of the bushes.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "Why, just hop on my back and I'll carry you across, Stinky Cheese Man."

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: "How do I know you won't eat me?"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: So the Stinky Cheese Man hopped on the fox's back.

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The fox swam to the middle of the river and said, "Oh man! What is that funky smell?"

title: THE STINKY CHEESE MAN AND OTHER FAIRLY STUPID TALES
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The fox coughed, gagged, and sneezed, and the Stinky Cheese Man flew off his back and into the river where he fell apart. The End.

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: Did you ever hear of Mickey, how he heard a racket in the night

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: And fell through the dark, out of his clothes

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: Past the moon & his mama & papa sleeping tight

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: Into the light of the night kitchen?

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: Where the bakers who bake till the dawn so we can have cake in the morn mixed Mickey in batter, chanting:

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: "Milk in the batter! Milk in the batter! Stir it! Scrape it! Make it! Bake it!"

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: And they put that batter up to bake a delicious Mickey-cake.

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: "I'm not the milk and the milk's not me! I'm Mickey!"

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: So he skipped from the oven & into bread dough

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: All ready to rise in the night kitchen.

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: He kneaded and punched it and pounded and pulled

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: Then Mickey in dough was just on his way

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: When the bakers ran up with a measuring cup, howling:

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: "What's all the fuss? I'm Mickey the pilot! I get milk the Mickey way!"

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: And he grabbed the cup as he flew up

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: And over the top of the Milky Way in the night kitchen.

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: Mickey the milkman dived down to the bottom

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: "I'm in the milk and the milk's in me."

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: "God bless milk and god bless me!"

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: Then he swam to the top, pouring milk from his cup into batter below -

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: So the bakers they mixed it and beat it and baked it.

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: "Milk in the batter! Milk in the batter!"

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: Now Mickey in the night kitchen cried

title: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN
author: MAURICE SENDAK
text: And that's why, thanks to Mickey

title: DR. SEUSS'S ABC
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You use it when you say:

title: FOX IN SOCKS
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I can't do it, Mr. Fox, sir.

title: FOX IN SOCKS
author: DR. SEUSS
text: battle with paddles in a puddle,

title: FOX IN SOCKS
author: DR. SEUSS
text: is a puddle in a bottle...

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABY!
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "Hop to it! Get dressed! It's your Day of all Days! It's the Best of the Best!"

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABY!
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And now, on this Day of all Days in Katroo, You'll be pulled through the air on a boat built for you. These goats never slip, never trip, never bungle. They'll take us down fast to the Birthday Flower Jungle.

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABY!
author: DR. SEUSS
text: We have grown to be sniffed

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABY!
author: DR. SEUSS
text: When we are done, I've got a hunch

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABY!
author: DR. SEUSS
text: There will be franks for Birthday Lunch...¦

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABY!
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Will that make us very flustered?

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABY!
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "Wash it off" is the simple rule.

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABY!
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Let's jump in the Ketchup-Mustard-Off Pool.

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABY!
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then, out of the water! Sing loud while you dry!

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABY!
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Sing loud, "I am lucky!" Sing loud, "I am I!"

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY, BABY!
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Which was baked just for you.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: On the far-away island of Sala-ma-Sond,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Yertle the Turtle was king of the pond.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: A nice little pond.  It was clean.  It was neat.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: The water was warm.  There was plenty to eat.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: The turtles had everything turtles might need.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And they were all happy.  Quite happy indeed.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They were... until Yertle, the king of them all,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Decided the kingdom he ruled was too small.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "I'm ruler", said Yertle, "of all that I see.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But I don't see enough.  That's the trouble with me.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: With this stone for a throne, I look down on my pond

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But I cannot look down on the places beyond.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: This throne that I sit on is too, too low down.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: It ought to be higher!" he said with a frown.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "If I could sit high, how much greater I'd be!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: What a king! I'd be ruler of all that I see!"

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So Yertle, the Turtle King, lifted his hand

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And Yertle, the Turtle King, gave a command.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: He ordered nine turtles to swim to his stone

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And, using these turtles, he built a new throne.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: He made each turtle stand on another one's back

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And he piled them all up in a nine-turtle stack.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And then Yertle climbed up.  He sat down on the pile.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: What a wonderful view! He could see 'most a mile!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "All mine!" Yertle cried.  "Oh, the things I now rule!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'm king of a cow! And I'm king of a mule!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'm king of a house! And, what's more, beyond that

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'm king of a blueberry bush and a cat!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'm Yertle the Turtle! Oh, marvelous me!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: For I am the ruler of all that I see!"

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And all through that morning, he sat there up high

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Saying over and over, "A great king am I!"

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Until 'long about noon.  Then he heard a faint sigh.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And he looked down the stack.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And he saw, at the bottom, a turtle named Mack.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Just a part of his throne.  And this plain little turtle

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Looked up and he said, "Beg your pardon, King Yertle.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "I've pains in my back and my shoulders and knees.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: How long must we stand here, Your Majesty, please?"

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "SILENCE!" the King of the Turtles barked back.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "I'm king, and you're only a turtle named Mack."

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "You stay in your place while I sit here and rule.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'm king of a cow! And I'm king of a mule!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'm king of a house! And a bush! And a cat!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But that isn't all.  I'll do better than that!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: My throne shall be higher!" his royal voice thundered,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "So pile up more turtles! I want 'bout two hundred!"

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "Turtles! More turtles!" he bellowed and brayed.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And the turtles 'way down in the pond were afraid.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They trembled.  They shook.  But they came.  They obeyed.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: From all over the pond, they came swimming by dozens.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Whole families of turtles, with uncles and cousins.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And all of them stepped on the head of poor Mack.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: One after another, they climbed up the stack.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: THEN Yertle the Turtle was perched up so high,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: He could see forty miles from his throne in the sky!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "Hooray!" shouted Yertle.  "I'm king of the trees!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'm king of the birds! And I'm king of the bees!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'm king of the butterflies! King of the air!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Ah, me! What a throne! What a wonderful chair!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'm Yertle the Turtle! Oh, marvelous me!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: For I am the ruler of all that I see!"

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then again, from below, in the great heavy stack,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Came a groan from that plain little turtle named Mack.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "Your Majesty, please... I don't like to complain,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But down here below, we are feeling great pain.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I know, up on top you are seeing great sights,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But down here at the bottom we, too, should have rights.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: We turtles can't stand it.  Our shells will all crack!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Besides, we need food.  We are starving!" groaned Mack.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "You hush up your mouth!" howled the mighty King Yertle.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "You've no right to talk to the world's highest turtle.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I rule from the clouds! Over land! Over sea!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: There's nothing, no, NOTHING, that's higher than me!"

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But, while he was shouting, he saw with sur  prise

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: That the moon of the evening was starting to rise

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Up over his head in the darkening skies.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: "What's THAT?" snorted Yertle.  "Say, what IS that thing

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: That dares to be higher than Yertle the King?

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I shall not allow it! I'll go higher still!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'll build my throne higher! I can and I will!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'll call some more turtles.  I'll stack 'em to heaven!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I need 'bout five thousand, six hundred and seven!"

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But, as Yertle, the Turtle King, lifted his hand

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And started to order and give the command,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: That plain little turtle below in the stack,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: That plain little turtle whose name was just Mack,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Decided he'd taken enough.  And he had.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And that plain little lad got a bit mad

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And that plain little Mack did a plain little thing.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And his burp shook the throne of the king!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And Yertle the Turtle, the king of the trees,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: The king of the air and the birds and the bees,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: The king of a house and a cow and a mule...

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Well, that was the end of the Turtle King's rule!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: For Yertle, the King of all Sala-ma-Sond,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Fell off his high throne and fell Plunk! in the pond!

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And today the great Yertle, that Marvelous he,

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Is King of the Mud.  That is all he can see.

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And the turtles, of course... all the turtles are free

title: YERTLE THE TURTLE
author: DR. SEUSS
text: As turtles and, maybe, all creatures should be.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If you are a dreamer, come in,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If you are a dreamer, a wisher, a liar,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A hope-er, a pray-er, a magic bean buyer ...

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If you're a pretender, come sit by my fire

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: For we have some flax-golden tales to spin.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: As we float through the breeze -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But all the magic I have known

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: This boat that we just built is just fine -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And don't try to tell us it's not.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The sides and the back are divine -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: It's the bottom I guess we forgot ...

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But ah, me - I'm such a dunce.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I went and ate them all at once.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: ICKLE ME, PICKLE ME, TICKLE ME TOO

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Ickle Me, Pickle Me, Tickle Me too

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Went for a ride in a flying shoe.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Said lckle Me, Pickle Me, Tickle Me too.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Ickle was captain, and Pickle was crew

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And Tickle served coffee and mulligan stew

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: lckle Me, Pickle Me, Tickle Me too.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Ickle Me, Pickle Me, Tickle Me too,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Over the sun and beyond the blue.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Cried Ickle Me, Pickle Me, Tickle Me too.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Ickle Me, Pickle Me, Tickle Me too

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Never returned to the world they knew,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Dear Ickle Me, Pickle Me, Tickle Me too.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And playing tag and pouring tea

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And turnin' pages of his book.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Lots of folks I'm glad I ain't -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I will not play at tug o' war.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'd rather play at hug o' war,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And it's rather dark in here.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Which may not be too clear.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But this afternoon by the lion's cage

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'm afraid I got too near.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And it's rather dark in here.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So you haven't got a drum, just beat your belly.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So I haven't got a horn - I'll play my nose.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So we haven't got any cymbals -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: We'll just slap our hands together,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And though there may be orchestras

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Hey we're making music twice as good

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: There are lots of other stars,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But I forget which ones they are.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My skin is kind of sort of brownish

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: y eyes are greyish blueish green,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But I'm told they look orange in the night.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My hair is reddish blondish brown,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But it's silver when it's wet.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And all the colors I am inside

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Mama said I'd lose my head

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: It fell off and rolled away

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And I can't look for it

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And I can't call to it

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So I guess I'll sit down

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And rest for just a minute ...

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: JIMMY JET AND HIS TV SET

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'll tell you the story of Jimmy Jet -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And you know what I tell you is true.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He loved to watch his TV set

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He watched all day, he watched all night

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Till he grew pale and lean,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: From "The Early Show" to "The Late Late Show"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He watched till his eyes were frozen wide,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And his bottom grew into his chair.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And his chin turned into a tuning dial,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And antennae grew out of his hair.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And his brains turned into TV tubes,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And his face to a TV screen.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Grew where his ears had been.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he grew a plug that looked like a tail

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So we plugged in little Jim.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And now instead of him watching TV

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: We all sit around and watch him.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Oh, if you're a bird, be an early bird

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And catch the worm for your breakfast plate.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If you're a bird, be an early early bird -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But if you're a worm, sleep late.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Through the crack in the ceiling

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I could have eaten a lentil-soup lake.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A bit of sky can make.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "She's coming," the farmer said to the owl.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "Oh, what shall I, what shall I do?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Shall I bow when she comes?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "The Queen, the Queen, the royal Queen -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Shall I salute?" he asked the horse.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "Shall I give her a gift?" he asked the wren.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "'A lovely memento for her to keep?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: An egg or a peach or an ear of corn?"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "But should I curtsy or should I cheer?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: What should I do?" he asked the dog.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And so he did, and so she passed,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "She smiled, she did!" he told the sheep.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Good little Grace looks up and says,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "I'll take the one in the middle."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My dad gave me one dollar bill

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And I swapped it for two shiny quarters

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And then I took the quarters

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: For three dimes - I guess he don't know

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: That three is more than two!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Just then, along came old blind Bates

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He gave me four nickels for my three dimes,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And four is more than three!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And I took the nickels to Hiram Coombs

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And the fool gave me five pennies for them,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And five is more than four!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And then I went and showed my dad,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he got red in the cheeks

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And closed his eyes and shook his head -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Too proud of me to speak!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he may be a bit

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But I guess there's worse things

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Instead of two we could be three,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'm making a list of the things I must say

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And goodness and kindness and gentleness,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If you know some that I've forgot,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: please stick them in your eye!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I have a friend who is a giant,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he lives where the tall weeds grow.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He's high as a mountain and wide as a barn,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And I only come up to his toe, you know,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I only come up to his toe.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: When the daylight grows dim I talk with him

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Way down in the marshy sands,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And his ear is too far away to hear,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: For we have a code called the "scratch-tap code,"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And here is what we do -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I scratch his toe ... once means, "Hello"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Three means, "Does it look like rain?"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Five times means, "I'll scratch you a joke."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he answers me by tapping his toe -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Two taps means, "It's very nice to feel your scratch again."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: With my head in the top of the sky."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Four taps means, "Today an eagle smiled as she flew by."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Five taps means, "Oops, I just bumped

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And eight means, "Come back soon, soon, soon"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And then I scratch a thousand times,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he taps with a bappity-bimm,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he laughs so hard he shakes the sky -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And looked up at the rain,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And it dripped in my head

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And all that I hear as I lie in my bed

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Is the slishity-slosh of the rain in my head.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So pardon the wild crazy thing I just said -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'm just not the same since there's rain in my head.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Two boxes met upon the road.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Said one unto the other, "If you're a box,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Then you must be my brother.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And we must get no thinner."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And so two boxes, hand in hand,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Went home to have their dinner.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: This morning I jumped on my horse

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And went out for a ride,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And some wild outlaws chased me

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And they shot me in the side.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So I crawled into a wildcat's cave

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: To find a place to hide,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But some pirates found me sleeping there,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And soon they had me tied

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: To a pole and built a fire

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Till a mermaid came and cut me loose

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And begged to be my bride,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So I said I'd come back Wednesday

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But I must admit I lied.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Then I ran into a jungle swamp

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And I stepped into some quicksand,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And no matter how I tried

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I couldn't get out, until I met

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Who pulled me to some cannibals

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Who planned to have me fried.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But an eagle came and swooped me up

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And through the air we flied,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But he dropped me in a boiling lake

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And you'll never guess what I did then -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'm being eaten by a boa constrictor,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And I don't like it - one bit.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And rusty bells that would not ring.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And stopped-up horns that wouldn't toot.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Butter knives that had no handles,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Copper keys that fit no locks,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Rings that were too small for fingers,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Worn-out belts that had no buckles,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Three-legged chairs and cups with cracks.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Loved these things with all his soul -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Loved them more than shining diamonds,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Loved them more than glistenin' gold.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Hector called to all the people,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And all the silly sightless people

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Came and looked ... and called it junk.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I've done it, I've done it!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Invented a light that plugs into the sun.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But, oh, there's only one thing wrong...

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The googies are coming, the old people say,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: To buy little children and take them away.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A nickel each for mean ones.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The googies are coming, and maybe tonight,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: To buy little children and lock them up tight.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A dollar for the meek ones.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And, kiddies, when they come to buy,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: It won't do any good to cry.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But - just between yourself and I -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: They never buy the bad ones!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: One crying and spying young sister for sale!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Oh, isn't there, isn't there, isn't there any

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: One kid who will buy this old sister for sale,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: This crying and spying young sister for sale?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "I'm tired of eating just beans," says I,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So I opened a can of sardines.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Till you let in the light.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: You big silly sap, let us finish our nap.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Will somebody please pass the beans?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If you were only one inch tall, you'd ride a worm to school.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The teardrop of a crying ant would be your swimming pool.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A crumb of cake would be a feast

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And last you seven days at least,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A flea would be a frightening beast

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If you were one inch tall.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If you were only one inch tall, you'd walk beneath the door,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And it would take about a month to get down to the store.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A bit of fluff would be your bed,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: You'd swing upon a spider's thread,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And wear a thimble on your head

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If you were one inch tall.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: You'd surf across the kitchen sink upon a stick of gum.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: You couldn't hug your mama, you'd just have to hug her thumb.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: You'd run from people's feet in fright,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: To move a pen would take all night,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: (This poem took fourteen years to write -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But please walk softly as you do.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Frogs dwell here and crickets too.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Jays dwell here and sunbeams too.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Floors are flowers - take a few.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Ferns grow here and daisies too.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Bats dwell here and hoot owls too.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Gnomes dwell here and goblins too.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And my child, I thought you knew

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I dwell here ... and so do you.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "I have the measles and the mumps,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A gash, a rash and purple bumps.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My mouth is wet, my throat is dry,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'm going blind in my right eye.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My tonsils are as big as rocks,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And there's one more - that's seventeen,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And don't you think my face looks green?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My leg is cut, my eyes are blue -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I cough and sneeze and gasp and choke,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'm sure that my left leg is broke -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My hip hurts when I move my chin,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My back is wrenched, my ankle's sprained,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My 'pendix pains each time it rains.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My nose is cold, my toes are numb,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: have a sliver in my thumb.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My neck is stiff, my voice is weak,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I hardly whisper when I speak.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My tongue is filling up my mouth,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I think my hair is falling out.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My elbow's bent, my spine ain't straight,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My brain is shrunk, I cannot hear,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: There is a hole inside my ear.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I have a hangnail, and my heart is - what?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: What's that? What's that you say?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
