author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: You'll see catsandratsandelephants, but sure as you're born

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: You're never gonna see no Unicorn.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A tree house, a free house,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A secret you and me house,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A high up in the leafy branches

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A street house, a neat house,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Be sure and wipe your feet house

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Is not my kind of house at all -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Let's go live in a tree house.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Oh I'm going to ride on The Flying Festoon -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'll jump on his back and I'll whistle a tune,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And we'll fly to the outermost tip of the moon,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'm taking a sandwich, and ball and a prune,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And we're leaving this evening precisely at noon,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: For I'm going to fly with The Flying Festoon ...

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Just as soon as he learns how to fly.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: When we turn off the light.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: When we turn off the light.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: When we turn off the light.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Is for God to just reach out

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And here we see the invisible boy

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Feeding a piece of invisible cheese

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Oh, what a beautiful picture to see!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Will you draw an invisible picture for me?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I tried to tip my hat to Miss McGaffry,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I never should have put it on so tight,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: 'Cause it wouldn't come off my head

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And my neck got stretched instead.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: That's what you get for tryin'

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'll sing you a poem of a silly young king

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Who played with the world at the end of a strong,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But he only loved one single thing -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And that was just a peanut-butter sandwich.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: His scepter and his royal gowns,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: His regal throne and golden crowns

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Were brown and sticky from the mounds

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And drippings from each peanut-butter sandwich.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: His subjects all were silly fools

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: For he had passed a royal rule

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: That all that they could learn in school

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Was how to make a peanut-butter sandwich.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He would not eat his sovereign steak,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He scorned his soup and kingly cake,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And told his courtly cook to bake

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And then one day he took a bite

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But found his mouth was stuck quite tight

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: From that last bite of peanut-butter sandwich.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: His brother pulled, his sister pried,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The wizard pushed, his mother cried,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: From eating his last peanut-butter sandwich!"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The dentist came, and the royal doc.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The royal plumber banged and knocked,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But still those jaws stayed tightly locked.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Oh darn that sticky peanut-butter sandwich!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The carpenter, he tried with pliers,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The telephone man tried with wires,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The firemen, they tried with fire,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But couldn't melt that peanut-butter sandwich.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: With ropes and pulleys, drills and coil,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: For twenty years of tears and toil -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: They fought that awful peanut-butter sandwich.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Then all his royal subjects came.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: They hooked his jaws with grapplin' chains

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And pulled both ways with might and main

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Each man and woman, girl and boy

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Put down their ploughs and pots and toys

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And pulled until kerack! Oh, joy -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: They broke right through that peanut-butter sandwich.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A puff of dust, a screech, a squeak -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The king's jaw opened with a creak.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And then in voice so faint and weak -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The first words that they heard him speak

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Columbus said the world is round?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Don't you believe a word of that.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: For I've been down to the edge of the world,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Sat on the edge where the wild wind whirled,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Peeked over the ledge where the blue smoke curls,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And I can tell you, boys and girls,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "This is the hour," said Santa Claus,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Then on his back he slung his pack,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And into his sleigh climbed he.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "On, Dancer! On, Prancer! On, Donner and Blitzen!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: On, Comet and Cupid!" cried he.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And all the reindeers leaped but one,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He had pulled the sleigh for a thousand years,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And never a word spoke he.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Now he stood in the snow, and he whispered low -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "Oh what do you have for me?"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "I have games and toys for girls and boys,"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The reindeer stood as if made of wood -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "But what do you have for me?"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "The socks are hung, the bells are rung!"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The reindeer winked at a falling star -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "But what do you have for me?"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Then Santa reached into his beard,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he found a tiny flea,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he put it into the reindeer's ear,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And the reindeer said, "For me? Oh gee!"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And into the blue away they flew,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Away they flew with the flea.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And the moral of this yuletide tale

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: You know as well as me.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: They have clothes just like ours,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And they have the same shoes and same laces,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And they have the same charms and same graces,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And they have the same heads and same faces ...

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Ricky was "L" but he's home with the flu,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Lizzie, our "O," had some homework to do,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Mitchell, "E" prob'ly got lost on the way,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So I'm all of love that could make it today.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: THE DIRTIEST MAN IN THE WORLD

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Oh I'm Dirty Dan, the world's dirtiest man,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I never have taken a shower.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I can't see my shirt - it's so covered with dirt,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And my ears have enough to grow flowers.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But the water is either a little too hot,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Or else it's a little too cold.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'm musty and dusty and patchy and scratchy

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And mangy and covered with mold.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But the water is always a little too hot,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Or else it's a little too cold.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I live in a pen with five hogs and a hen

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And three squizzly lizards who creep in

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My bed, and they itch as I squirm, and I twitch

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: In the cruddy old sheets that I sleep in.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If you looked down my throat with a flashlight, you'd note

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: That my insides are coated with rust.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I creak when I walk and I squeak when I talk,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And each time I sneeze I blow dust.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The thought of a towel and some soap makes me howl.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And when people have something to tell me

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: They don't come and tell it - they stand back and yell it.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I think they're afraid they might smell me.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The bedbugs that leap on me sing me to sleep,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And the garbage flies buzz me awake.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: They're the best friends I've found and I fear they might drown

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So I never go too near a lake.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Each evening at nine I sit down to dine

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: With the termites who live in my chair,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And I joke with the bats and have intimate chats

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: With the cooties who crawl through my hair.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'd brighten my life if I just found a wife,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But I fear that that never will be

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Until I can find a girl, gentle and kind,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: With a beautiful face and a sensitive mind,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Who sparkles and twinkles and glistens and shines -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And who's almost as dirty as me.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: When you stop and try to see it

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: From the turkey's point of view.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Easter feasts are just bad luck

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: When you see it from the viewpoint

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Of a chicken or a duck.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Oh how I once loved tuna salad

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Pork and lobsters, lamb chops too

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Till I stopped and looked at dinner

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: From the dinner's point of view.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: She said I was a silly moo,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: She said I was a liar too,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: She dared me prove that it was true,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And so what could I do -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Spaghetti, spaghetti, all over the place,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Up to my elbows - up to my face,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Over the carpet and under the chairs,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Into the hammock and wound round the stairs,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Filling the bathtub and covering the desk,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Making the sofa a mad mushy mess.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The party is ruined, I'm terribly worried,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The guests have all left (unless they're all buried).

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I told them, "Bring presents." I said, "Throw confetti."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Agatha Fry, she made a pie,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And Christopher John helped bake it.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Christopher John, he mowed the lawn,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And Agatha Fry helped rake it.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Zachary Zugg took out the rug,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And Jennifer Joy helped shake it.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And Jennifer Joy, she made a toy,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And Zachary Zugg helped break it.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I would name him Horace or Morris.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But if suddenly one day he had

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: His buttons will not come undone.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He hasn't changed his clothes since last July.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: No matter how they try, poor guy.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And all that he can take off are his socks and shoes and tie,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And all that he can do is sit and bite his tongue and cry,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he cannot take a bath - so just lets the water run,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he can't go to the toilet, and he can't get any sun,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And life just isn't any fun

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Whose buttons will not come undone.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: May I ask you if you've noticed,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: May I ask you if you've seen

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: For you've gone and drunk it up, dear,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And she isn't in the cup, dear,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And she's nowhere to be found, dear.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Do you think that she has drowned, dear?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: As he cuts all the grass on your lawn,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Or swishity - it will be gone.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: [[PLEASE DO NOT MAKE FUN OF ME AND PLEASE DON'T LAUGH IT ISN'T EASY TO WRITE A POEM ON THE NECK OF A RUNNING GIRAFFE.]]

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Who feeds upon poets and tea.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Luckily, I know this about him

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: While he knows almost nothing of me!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Where the weeds and mudglumps grow,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A Yipiyuk bit on my toe ...

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Exactly why I do not know.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The Yipiyuk would not let go.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I whispered to him soft and low -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The Yipiyuk would not let go.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The Yipiyuk would not let go.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Yes, that was sixteen years ago,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And the Yipiyuk still won't let go.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The Yipiyuk will not let go.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The snow may melt, the grass may grow -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The Yipiyuk will not let go.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I drag him 'round each place I go,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: This Yipiyuk will not let go.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And now my child at last you know

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Exactly why I walk so slow.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: What's in the sack? What's in the sack?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Is it some mushrooms or is it the moon?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Is it love letters or downy goosefeathers?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Or maybe the world's most enormous balloon?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: What's in the sack? That's all they ask me.

author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he cuddled her and teased her

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And so lovingly he squeezed her.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Said the turtle to the bagpipe, "Did you honk or bray or neigh?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: For 'Aaooga' when you're kissed is such a heartless thing to say.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Is it that I have offended?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Is it that our love is ended?"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And the bagpipe didn't say no.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Said the turtle to the bagpipe, "Shall I leave you, darling wife?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Shall I waddle off to Woedom? Shall I crawl out of your life?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Shall I move, depart and go, dear -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Oh, I beg you tell me 'No,' dear!"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But the bagpipe didn't say no.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So the turtle crept off crying and he ne'er came back no more,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he left the bagpipe lying on that smooth and sandy shore.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And some night when tide is low there,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Just walk up and say, "Hello, there,"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And politely ask the bagpipe if this story's really so.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I assure you, darling children, that the bagpipe won't say "No."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: [[THE LONGEST NOSE IN THE WORLD, BELONGS TO MISS BETSY BLUE BONNET - WHO LETS ME WRITE THINGS ON IT.]]

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Someday he will go to hell

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Or jail or Canada, but now

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Every night I pray that first

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Rudy Felsh will show me how.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: From out of the cold Caribbean

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But I want to call him "Fred"!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: There was a boy in our town with long hair -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And when he walked down the street

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And run in and slam their door

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And shout at him from the window

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Until he couldn't stand it anymore.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So he sat down and cried

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And pretty soon his hair shook too,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Straight up in the air like a helicopter.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Jenny Ricks saw him and dropped her

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Knitting and screamed, "It's a flying kid!"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Tried to shoot him down, but missed -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "I thought he was a crow," he said.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And 'round he sailed all through the day,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: With the wind in his hair

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And the sun in his eyes.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: We saw him swoop and bank and rise.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: On Yerbey's lawn and almost crashed

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Zoomed up in time and almost hit

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The courthouse. Old Man Cooley bit

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Right through his napkin when he saw

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A kid fly through the diner door -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And out of the window, tipping the ladder -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Where Smokey was painting, he almost had a

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Heart attack - he clung to a rafter. The kid flew on -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Come down here, kid. We'd like to say

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: How proud of you we are today.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Town would have a hero in it?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So I'd like to proclaim this day - hey, kid!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Will you please come down for just a minute?"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But the flying kid did not come down.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He treaded air above the town,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Sort of cryin' and looking down

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: At all of us here on the ground.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Then up be flew, up into the clouds,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Flapping and flying so far and high,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Out past the hills and into the sky

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Until a tiny speck against the sun

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Was all we could see of him ... then he was gone.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I have a Band-Aid on my finger,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: One on my knee, and one on my nose,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: One on my heel, and two on my shoulder,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: hree on my elbow, and nine on my toes.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Two on my wrist, and one on my ankle,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: One on my chin, and one on my thigh,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Four on my belly, and five on my bottom,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: One on my forehead, and one on my eye.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: One on my neck, and in case I might need 'em

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I have a box full of thirty-five more.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But oh! I do think it's sort of a pity

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I don't have a cut or a sore!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So she won't be out to play.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: We'll never hear her whiney cry

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Or have to feel if she is dry.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: We'll give away her toys and clothes.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: We'll never have to wipe her nose.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Dad says, "That's the way it goes."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: What a frightful thing to eat!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: It was a heartless thing to do.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The policemen haven 't got a clue.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Would go and (burp) eat the baby.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And where is our dear Skinny

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: in that tub in the sky

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Have you been to The Land of Happy,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Where they joke and they sing

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: There's no one unhappy in Happy,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I have been to The Land of Happy -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "Then you must steer us through the gale."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "Then down with the galley slaves you go."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "Then you must be the pirate's clerk."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "Then a pirate captain you must be."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The little fish eats the tiny fish,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The big fish eats the little fish -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So only the biggest fish get fat.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Do you know any folks like that?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If the world was crazy, you know what I'd eat?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A big slice of soup and a whole quart of meat,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A lemonade sandwich, and then I might try

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Some roasted ice cream or a bicycle pie,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A nice notebook salad, an underwear roast,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: An omelet of hats and some crisp cardboard toast,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A thick malted milk made from pencils and daisies,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And that's what I'd eat if the world was crazy.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If the world was crazy, you know what I'd wear?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A chocolate suit and a tie of eclair,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Some marshmallow earmuffs, some licorice shoes,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And I'd read a paper of peppermint news.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'd call the boys "Suzy" and I'd call the girls "Harry,"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'd talk through my ears, and I always would carry

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A paper umbrella for when it grew hazy

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: To keep in the rain, if the world was crazy.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If the world was crazy, you know what I'd do?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'd walk on the ocean and swim in my shoe,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'd fly through the ground and I'd skip through the air,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'd run down the bathtub and bathe on the stair.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: When I met somebody I'd say "G'bye, Joe,"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And when I was leaving - then I'd say "Hello."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And the greatest of men would be silly and lazy

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So I would be king ... if the world was crazy.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: How do we tell if a window is open?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Just throw a stone at it.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Chester come to school and said,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: While fishing in the blue lagoon

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I caught a lovely silver fish,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he spoke to me. "My boy," quoth he,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "Please set me free and I'll grant your wish ...

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A kingdom of wisdom? A palace of gold?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Or all the goodies your fancies can hold?"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So I said, "OK," and I threw him free,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he swam away and he laughed at me

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Today I caught that fish again,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: That lovely silver prince of fishes,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And once again he offered me -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If I would only set him free -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Any one of a number of wonderful wishes ....

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Once I spoke the language of the flowers,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Once I understood each word the caterpillar said,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Once I smiled in secret at the gossip of the starlings,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And shared a conversation with the housefly

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Once I heard and answered all the questions

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And joined the crying of each falling dying

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Once I spoke the language of the flowers ....

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Said General Clay to General Gore,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "Oh must we fight this silly war?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: To kill and die is such a bore."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Said General Gore to General Clay,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "We could go to the beach today

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And have some ice cream on the way."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Said General Clay to General Gore,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "We'll build sand castles on the shore."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Said General Gore, "We'll splash and play."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "Let's leave right now," said General Clay.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Said General Gore to General Clay,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "But what if the sea is closed today?

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And what if the sand's been blown away?"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Said General Gore to General Clay,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And we may drown!" "It's true, we may.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: It chills my blood," said General Clay.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Said General Clay to General Gore,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: We'd better go on with our war."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Then General Clay charged General Gore

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: As bullets flew and cannons roared.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And now, alas! there is no more

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Of General Clay or General Gore.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Sweet Marie, she loves just me

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: No she don't, she loves just me

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: No she don't, she loves just me

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: No she don't, she loves just me!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: (Poor, poor fool, why can't you see

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: She can love others and still love thee.)

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: With my finger in my ear,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: While I watched a yellow caterpillar

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: You should have heard the old men cry,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: You should have heard the biddies

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: When that sad stranger raised his flute

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: John and Nils and Cousin Claire,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: 'Cross the hills to God knows where -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: 'Cross the hills to God knows where

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Each child in Hamlin Town but me,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My papa says that I was blest

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: For if that music found me,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'd be witch-cast like all the rest.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: This town grows old around me.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I cannot say I did not hear

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I heard, I heard, I heard it clear ...

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Have you heard of tiny Melinda Mae,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So she started in right at the tail.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And everyone said, "You're much too small,"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: But that didn't bother Melinda at all.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: She took little bites and she chewed very slow,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Just like a good girl should ...

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: ... And in eighty-nine years she ate that whale

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The little blue engine looked up at the hill.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: His light was weak, his whistle was shrill.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He was tired and small, and the hill was tall,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And his face blushed red as he softly said,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "I think I can, I think I can, I think I can."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So he started up with a chug and a strain,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And he puffed and pulled with might and main.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And slowly he climbed, a foot at a time,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And his engine coughed as he whispered soft,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "I think I can, I think I can, I think I can."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: With a squeak and a creak and a toot and a sigh,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: With an extra hope and an extra try,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He would not stop - now he neared the top -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And strong and proud he cried out loud,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: "I think I can, I think I can, I think I can!"

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He was almost there, when - CRASH! SMASH! BASH!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He slid down and mashed into engine hash

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: On the rocks below ... which goes to show

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: If the track is tough and the hill is rough,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: THINKING you can just ain't enough!

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'm Reginald Clark, I'm afraid of the dark

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So I always insist on the light on,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And my thumby to suck or to bite on.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Two prayers, and five hugs from my mommy,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I'm Reginald Clark, I'm afraid of the dark

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: So please do not close this book on me.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Took his knife and spoon and fork,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Ate a bowl of mushroom soup, ate a slice of roasted pork,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Ate a dozen stewed tomatoes, twenty-seven deviled eggs,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A shank of lamb, a boiled ham,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Two bowls of grits, some black-eye peas,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Four chocolate shakes, eight angel cakes,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Nine custard pies with Muenster cheese,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Ten pots of tea, and after he

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Had eaten all that he was able,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He poured some broth on the tablecloth

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: His parents said, "Oh Hungry Mungry, stop these silly jokes."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Mungry opened up his mouth, and "Gulp," he ate his folks.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And then he went and ate his house, all the bricks and wood,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And then he ate up all the people in the neighborhood.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Up came twenty angry policemen shouting, "Stop and cease."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Mungry opened up his mouth and "Gulp," he ate the police.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Soldiers came with tanks and guns.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He just smiled and licked his lips and ate the U.S. Army.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: The President sent all his bombers - Mungry still was calm,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Put his head back, gulped the planes, and gobbled up the bomb.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He ate his town and ate the city - ate and ate and ate -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And then he said, "I think I'll eat the whole United States."

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And so he ate Chicago first and munched the Water Tower,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And then he chewed on Pittsburgh but he found it rather sour.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He ate New York and Tennessee, and all of Boston town,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Then drank the Mississippi River just to wash it down.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And when he'd eaten every state, each puppy, boy and girl

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He wiped his mouth upon his sleeve and went to eat the world.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He ate the Egypt pyramids and every church in Rome,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And all the grass in Africa and all the ice in Nome.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He ate each hill in green Brazil and then to make things worse

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He decided for dessert he'd eat the universe.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He started with the moon and stars and soon as he was done

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He gulped the clouds, he sipped the wind and gobbled up the sun.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Then sitting there in the cold dark air,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: He started to nibble his feet,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Then his legs. then his hips

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Then his neck, then his lips

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Till he sat there just gnashin' his teeth

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: My beard grows to my toes,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And down the road I goes.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: No one's lookin' up to see

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: A new star in the sky.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And no one loves a Christmas tree

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I went to find the pot of gold

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: That's waiting where the rainbow ends.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: I searched and searched and searched and searched

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: And searched and searched, and then -

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: There it was, deep in the grass,

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: Under an old and twisty bough.

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: It's mine it's mine, it's mine at last....

title: WHERE THE SIDEWALK ENDS
author: SHEL SILVERSTEIN
text: What do I search for now?

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: Little Owl was having a wonderful night.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: He watched the funny possum family waddle along in a neat row.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: Hedgehog sniffed around the mushroom patch.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: Skunk was eating berries because he could find no snails.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: By the river, beavers gnawed at trees.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: Turtle hid in her shell as fireflies danced all around.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: Little Owl visited his friend the raccoon. As they sat in the clover, fog rolled in and hovered just overhead.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: Moths fluttered toward the moon. Silver dust fell from their wings.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: Little Owl wanted to follow, but it was time to head home.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: On the way, Little Owl flew by Grumbly Cave. Bear was inside, snoring up a storm.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: "Wake up, Bear! Don't sleep all night!" Little Owl sang. "I want to show you the moon!"

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: But the bear kept snoring, as usual. Little Owl flew home to his tree, gazing at the sky.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: He wondered if the bear had ever seen stars.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: Little Owl sat on his branch. How he loved the night forest!

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: Little Owl heard rustling at the foot of his tree. Fox had come to say hello.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: It was late now. The bats were gliding home. "Mama," Little Owl whispered, "tell me again how night ends."

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: "The moon and stars fade to ghosts," Mama said. "Spiderwebs turn to silver threads. Dewdrops sparkle on leaves and grass like tiny stars come down."

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: "Moonflowers close and morning glories open. The sky brightens from black to blue, blue to red, red to gold."

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: "The rooster crows. The crows caw. And the day begins," said Mama.

title: LITTLE OWL'S NIGHT
author: DIVYA SRINIVASAN
text: But Little Owl did not hear.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Mrs. Bobbin, the dressmaker, was tired and had a bad headache, but she still managed to sew the last stitches in the gown she was making.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: 'It's the most beautiful dress in the whole world!' said her daughter, Irene. 'The duchess will love it.'

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: 'It is nice,' her mother admitted. 'But, dumpling, it's for tonight's ball, and I don't have the strength to bring it. I feel sick.'

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: 'Poor Mama,' said Irene. 'I can get it there!'

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: 'No, cupcake, I can't let you,' said Mrs. Bobbin. 'Such a huge package, and it's such a long way to the palace. Besides, it's starting to snow.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: 'But I love snow,' Irene insisted. She coaxed her mother into bed, covered her with two quilts, and added a blanket for her feet. Then she fixed her some tea with lemon and honey and put more wood in the stove.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: With great care, Irene took the splendid gown down from the dummy and packed it in a big box with plenty of tissue paper.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: 'Dress warmly, pudding,' her mother called in a weak voice, 'and don't forget to button up. It's cold out there, and windy.'

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Irene put on her fleece-lined boots, her red hat and muffler, her heavy coat, and her mittens. She kissed her mother's hot forehead six times, then once again, made sure she was tucked in snugly, and slipped out with the big box, shutting the door firmly behind her.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: It really was cold outside, very cold. The wind whirled the falling snowflakes about, this way, that way, and into Irene's squinting face. She set out on the uphill path to Farmer Bennett's sheep pasture.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: By the time she got there, the snow was up to her ankles and the wind was worse. It hurried her along and made her stumble. Irene resented this; the box was problem enough. 'Easy does it!' she cautioned the wind, leaning back hard against it.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: By the middle of the pasture, the flakes were falling thicker. Now the wind drove Irene along so rudely she had to hop, skip, and go helter-skeltering over the knobby ground. Cold snow sifted into her boots and chilled her feet. She pushed out her lip and hurried on. This was an important errand.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: When she reached Apple Road, the wind decided to put on a show. It ripped branches from trees and flung them about, swept up and scattered the fallen snow, got in front of Irene to keep her from moving ahead. Irene turned around and pressed on backwards.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: 'Go home!' the wind squalled. 'Irene . . . go hooooooome. . .'

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: 'I will do no such thing,' she snapped. 'No such thing, you wicked wind!'

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: 'Go ho-o-ome,' the wind yodeled. 'GO HO-WO-WOME,' it shrieked, 'or else.' For a short second, Irene wondered if she shouldn't heed the wind's warning. But no! The gown had to get to the duchess!

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: The wind wrestled her for the package - walloped it, twisted it, shook it, snatched at it. But Irene wouldn't yield. 'It's my mother's work!' she screamed.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Then - oh, woe! - the box was wrenched from her mittened grasp and send bumbling along in the snow. Irene went after it.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: She pounced and took hold, but the ill-tempered wind ripped the box open. The ball gown flounced out and went waltzing through the powdered air with tissue-paper attendants.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Irene clung to the empty box and watched the beautiful gown disappear.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: How could anything so terribly wrong be allowed to happen? Tears froze on her lashes. Her dear mother's hard work, all those days of measuring, cutting, pinning, stitching . . . for this? And the poor duchess! Irene decided she would have to trudge on with just the box and explain everything in person.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: She went shuffling through the snow. Would her mother understand, she wondered, that it was the wind's fault, not hers? Would the duchess be angry? The wind was howling like a wild animal.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Suddenly Irene stepped in a hole and fell over with a twisted ankle. She blamed it on the wind. 'Keep quiet!' she scolded. 'You've done enough damage already. You've spoiled everything! Everything!' The wind swallowed up her words.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: She sat in the snow in great pain, afraid she wouldn't be able to go on. But she managed to get to her feet and start moving. It hurt. Home, where she longed to be, where she and her mother could be warm together, was far behind. It's got to be closer to the palace, she thought. But where any place was in all this snow, she couldn't be sure.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: She plowed on, dragging furrows with her sore foot. The short winter day was almost done.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Am I still going the right way, she wondered. There was no one around to advise her. Whoever else there was in this snow-covered world was far, far away, and safe indoors - even the animals in their burrows. She went plodding on.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Soon night took over. She knew in the dark that the muffled snow was still falling - she could feel it. She was cold and alone in the middle of nowhere. Irene was lost.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: She had to keep moving. She was hoping she'd come to a house, any house at all, and be taken in. She badly needed to be in someone's arms. The snow was above her knees now. She shoved her way through it, clutching the empty box.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: She was asking how long a small person could keep this struggle up, when she realized it was getting lighter. There was a soft glow coming from somewhere below her.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: She waded toward this glow, and soon was gazing down a long slope at a brightly lit mansion. It had to be the palace!

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Irene pushed forward with all her strength and - sloosh! thwump! - she plunged downward and was buried. She had fallen off a little cliff. Only her hat and the box in her hands stuck out above the snow.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Even if she could call for help, no one would hear her. Her body shook. Her teeth chattered. Why not freeze to death, she thought, and let all these troubles end. Why not? She was already buried.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: And never see her mother's face again? Her good mother who smelled like fresh-baked bread? In an explosion of fury, she flung her body about to free herself and was finally able to climb up on her knees and look around.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: How to get down to that glittering palace? As soon as she raised the question, she had the answer.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: She laid the box down and climbed aboard. But it pressed into the snow and stuck. She tried again, and this time, instead of climbing on, she leaped. The box shot forward, like a sled.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: The wind raced after Irene but couldn't keep up. In a moment she would be with people again, inside where it was warm. The sled slowed and jerked to a stop on paving stones.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: The time had come to break the bad news to the duchess. With the empty box clasped to her chest, Irene strode nervously toward the palace.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: But then her feet stopped moving and her mouth fell open. She stared. Maybe this was impossible, yet there it was, a little way off and over to the right, hugging the trunk of a tree - the beautiful ball gown! The wind was holding it there.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: She managed somehow, despite the wind's meddling, to get the gown off the tree and back in its box. And in another moment she was at the door of the palace. She knocked twice with the big brass knocker. The door opened and she burst in.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: She was welcomed by cheering servants and a delirious duchess. They couldn't believe she had come over the mountain in such a storm, all by herself. She had to tell the whole story, every detail. And she did.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Then she asked to be taken right back to her sick mother. But it was out of the question, they said; the road that ran around the mountain wouldn't be cleared till morning.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: 'Don't fret, child,' said the duchess. 'Your mother is surely sleeping now. We'll get you there first thing tomorrow.'

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Irene was given a good dinner as she sat by the fire, the moisture steaming off her clothes. The duchess, meanwhile, got into her freshly ironed gown before the guests began arriving in their sleighs.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: What a wonderful ball it was! The duchess in her new gown was like a bright star in the sky. Irene in her ordinary dress was radiant. She was swept up into dances by handsome aristocrats, who kept her feet off the floor to spare her ankle. Her mother would enjoy hearing all about it.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Early the next morning, when snow had long since ceased falling, Mrs. Bobbin woke from a good night's sleep feeling much improved. She hurried about and got a fire going in the cold stove. Then she went to look in on Irene.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: But Irene's bed was empty! She ran to the window and gazed at the white landscape. No one out there. Snow powder fell from the branch of a tree.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: 'Where is my child?' Mrs. Bobbin cried. She whipped on her coat to go out and find her.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: When she pulled the door open, a wall of drift faced her. But peering over it, she could see a horse-drawn sleigh hastening up the path. And seated on the sleigh, between two large footmen, was Irene herself, asleep but smiling.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Would you like to hear the rest?

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Well, there was a bearded doctor in the back of the sleigh. And the duchess had sent Irene's mother a ginger cake with white icing, some oranges and a pineapple, and spice candy of many flavors, along with a note saying how much she cherished her gown, and what a brave and loving person Irene was.

title: BRAVE IRENE
author: WILLIAM STEIG
text: Which, of course, Mrs. Bobbin knew. Better than the duchess.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: of everything I need for school.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Let's see... what have I missed?

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: two flashlights, and a tool set,

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Huh? Mom says to put those things

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: back where I took them from.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: She says that I won't need that stuff.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: She promised school won't be too rough.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: My teacher did a magic trick

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I don't know how, but-Presto! Poof! -

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: And just like that she seemed to know

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: how good I am at art!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I think she used some magic spells

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: to make the whole day fun.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Of all the teachers in the world,

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I'm glad that she's my one!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Crisscross applesauce, that's the way we sit.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Not cottage cheese on your knees.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Not blueberry jelly on your belly.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: But crisscross applesauce, that's the way we sit!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: which book will we read today?

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I love you, yellow lunch box.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Click! I open you to see

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: what did Mom pack for me?

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: below those good things I should eat.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: you're my favorite part, the treat!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I was munching on my apple

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: and I had a little hunch.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I'm a queen of this whole town!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: we are all these things and

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: and we head back in the door!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: There are 22 children here in Room 109,

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: a guinea pig, 3 goldfish, and 1 cuddle bear-mine!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: There's 1 really nice teacher with 8 buttons on her dress

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: and 1 billion purple polka dots (more or less).

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: There are 39 crayons that fell out of the box,

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: 24 food cans in our make-believe shop...

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: You say nap time? Not for me!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Oh no, I WILL NOT GO TO...

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Hooray! Hooray! A field trip day!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: We squeal and hoot, we screech and roar

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: and stomp the whole way through,

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: just like a bunch of animals

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: but she talked so much to Shauna

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: that I made my best friend Gus.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: But Gus said he was Noah's friend

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: so I had to go and trade him

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: for a better best friend, Zack.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Zack wouldn't share the box of blocks,

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: so what else could I do?

author: D.J. STEINBERG

author: D.J. STEINBERG

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Then someone came and asked me,

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: So... on the bus ride home again,

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: my new, NEW best friend was Heather.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I have a Kindergarten friend who isn't very big.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I'm talking bout George Washington, our classroom guinea pig.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I always stop to talk to him about the stuff we like.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I tell him what's on TV and how to ride a bike.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I'm teaching him his ABCs and how to draw a heart.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: He always pays attention-that George is clearly very smart!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: was a lot when I was small,

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: but now that it's the 100th day,

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I am old enough to say-

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: 100 isn't all that many, many days at all!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I could have brought in cuddle bear

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I could have brought my snow globe

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I could have brought my goldfish-

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: except I didn't think of that.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: So now my hands are empty

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: But hang on! I see something

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: staring right in front of me.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: on my finger while I stand.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Then I make my thumb into a mouth-

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: But I go s l o w l y...

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I was picked the line leader!

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: We planted seeds in paper cups

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: and put them on the sill.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I peeked today and-check it out-

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: What happened to my favorite pants?

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: The ones that used to fit.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Now they come up to my knees

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: My toes can't wiggle in my shoes

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: the way they used to do.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I think somebody shrunk my clothes.

title: KINDERGARTEN, HERE I COME!
author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: Or could it be I grew?

author: D.J. STEINBERG
text: I said, 'We're going to first grade,

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: He was too grumpy to eat.

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: He was too grumpy to play.

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: In fact, he was too grumpy to fly.

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: "Looks like I'm walking today," said Bird.

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: "Good morning, Bird," said Sheep. "What are you doing?"

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: "Hi there, Bird," said Rabbit. "What are you doing?"

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: "I could use some exercise," said Rabbit. "I'll walk, too."

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: "Hey, Bird," said Raccoon. "What are you doing?"

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: "I'm walking," snapped Bird. "What does it look like?"

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: "It looks like fun," said Raccoon. "I'm coming, too."

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: "Let me give you a hint," said Bird. "You do it

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: by placing one food in front of the other."

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: "Good day, Bird," said Fox. "What are you doing?"

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: "WHY DOES EVERYONE WANT TO KNOW WHAT I'M

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: DOING!!" shouted Bird. "I'm just walking, okay?"

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: The other animals stood on one leg.

title: GRUMPY BIRD
author: JEREMY TANKARD
text: "Let's fly back to my nest for a snack."

title: ELOISE

text: For instance every day I have to go to the

title: ELOISE
author: KAY THOMPSON
text: Desk Clerk and see what's happening there

title: ELOISE

title: ELOISE

title: ELOISE

title: ELOISE
author: KAY THOMPSON

title: ELOISE

title: ELOISE

text: I live on the top floor

title: ELOISE

text: For instance if I happen to be on the second floor I just

title: ELOISE

text: press that button until it comes up and as soon as that

title: ELOISE
author: KAY THOMPSON

title: ELOISE

title: ELOISE

title: ELOISE
author: KAY THOMPSON

title: ELOISE
author: KAY THOMPSON
text: I press that button and when that same elevator comes up and

title: ELOISE
author: KAY THOMPSON
text: as soon as that door is open I get in and say "15th floor

title: ELOISE
author: KAY THOMPSON
text: please" and then when those doors clank shut we ride up

title: ELOISE

title: ELOISE

title: ELOISE

title: ELOISE

text: clank shut and we ride down without saying absolutely one word

title: WHEREVER YOU ARE MY LOVE WILL FIND YOU
author: NANCY TILLMAN

title: WHEREVER YOU ARE MY LOVE WILL FIND YOU

text: just lift up your face, feel the wind in your hair.

title: WHEREVER YOU ARE MY LOVE WILL FIND YOU
author: NANCY TILLMAN
text: That's me, my sweet baby, my love is right there.

title: WHEREVER YOU ARE MY LOVE WILL FIND YOU
author: NANCY TILLMAN
text: In the green of the grass... in the smell of

title: WHEREVER YOU ARE MY LOVE WILL FIND YOU
author: NANCY TILLMAN
text: the sea... in the clouds floating by...

title: WHEREVER YOU ARE MY LOVE WILL FIND YOU
author: NANCY TILLMAN
text: at the top of a tree... in the sound

title: WHEREVER YOU ARE MY LOVE WILL FIND YOU
author: NANCY TILLMAN
text: crickets make at the end of the day...

title: WHEREVER YOU ARE MY LOVE WILL FIND YOU
author: NANCY TILLMAN
text: "You are loved. You are loved. You are

title: WHEREVER YOU ARE MY LOVE WILL FIND YOU

text: My love is so high, and so wide and

title: WHEREVER YOU ARE MY LOVE WILL FIND YOU

text: so deep, it's always right there, even
